courses.title: Controller To FP&A
courses.bio: Bridge the Gap from Controller to FP&A: Master Strategic Financial Planning, Analysis, and Decision-Making
requirements: Familiarity with accounting concepts and financial statements (e.g., P&L, balance sheet, and cash flow) is helpful.
A background in finance, accounting, or a related field will provide valuable context for transitioning into FP&A.
Curiosity about financial planning, analysis, and decision-making processes is beneficial.
This course is designed to guide controllers and finance professionals into FP&A roles, making it accessible to beginners in this field.
courses.description:
Are you ready to transition from a Controller role to the dynamic world of FP&A? This course is designed to help you make a seamless shift while mastering the skills needed to excel in financial planning and analysis.
You’ll begin by understanding the key differences between Controllers and FP&A professionals, gaining clarity on how these roles complement each other. Dive deep into the day-to-day responsibilities of FP&A, including budgeting, forecasting, variance analysis, and management commentaries. Learn how to interpret data and present actionable insights that influence strategic decisions.
The course also provides an insider’s view of the Office of the CFO, highlighting how FP&A supports long-term business objectives. Through practical exercises like creating B2B revenue budgets and forecasting scenarios, you’ll apply your learning in real-world contexts.
Designed for Controllers, accountants, and finance professionals, this course requires no prior FP&A experience. It offers actionable advice on preparing for FP&A roles, with a focus on developing critical skills CFOs look for, such as analytical thinking, stakeholder communication, and strategic planning.
By the end of this course, you’ll be ready to transition into an FP&A role with confidence, armed with the knowledge and tools to make an impact.
Take the first step in your journey to FP&A mastery—enroll today!
target_audience: Those looking to transition from accounting or controllership roles into FP&A.
Mid-level finance experts who want to expand their skillset and move towards strategic finance roles.
Leaders seeking to understand how FP&A can support better decision-making and drive business growth.
Individuals aiming to break into FP&A and seeking a clear roadmap for success.
Those exploring career paths in FP&A and seeking practical insights into the role.

courses.title: Introducción a los Seguros
courses.bio: Aprende desde los fundamentos básicos hasta gestión de riesgos, normativa y diseño de productos de seguros.
objectives: Aprenderás los fundamentos del seguro. Comprenderás los diferentes tipos y la importancia de evaluar las necesidades individuales de seguro.
Desarrollarás habilidades en gestión de riesgos. Identificarás, analizarás y gestionarás riesgos para tomar decisiones estratégicas en el sector asegurador.
Identificarás el concepto de agrupamiento de riesgos. Comprenderás cómo funciona y diseñarás productos de seguro aprovechando el agrupamiento de riesgos.
Analizarás temas de ética y responsabilidad. Abordarás principios éticos y cumplimiento de normativas legales en la industria de seguros.
Implementarás conocimientos en situaciones reales. Aplicarás habilidades adquiridas para enfrentar desafíos y aprovechar oportunidades en el campo del seguro.

Fundamentos del Seguro: Evaluación de Necesidades de los Seguros
Agrupamiento de Riesgos (Risk Pooling): Gestión de Riesgos en Risk Pooling
Ética y Normativa en Seguros: Ley de Distribución de Seguros - IDD

requirements: No se requiere experiencia previa.
courses.description:
¡Te doy la bienvenida al curso de Introducción a los Seguros! Este programa está diseñado para brindar a los participantes una comprensión sólida y completa del sector asegurador, desde sus fundamentos básicos hasta aspectos más avanzados relacionados con la gestión de riesgos y la ética en la industria.
Durante el desarrollo del curso, los estudiantes serán guiados a través de una exploración detallada de los conceptos clave del seguro. Comenzando con una introducción a los fundamentos, los participantes aprenderán sobre los diferentes tipos de seguros, incluyendo vida, salud, propiedad y responsabilidad, así como la importancia de evaluar las necesidades individuales de seguro.
A medida que avanzamos, nos sumergiremos en el análisis y la evaluación de riesgos en el sector asegurador. Exploraremos métodos y herramientas para identificar y gestionar riesgos, así como estrategias efectivas para mitigarlos. Este conocimiento es fundamental para la toma de decisiones estratégicas tanto para las aseguradoras como para los asegurados.
Además, examinaremos el concepto de agrupamiento de riesgos (Risk Pooling) y su aplicación en la industria de seguros. Los estudiantes comprenderán cómo funciona el agrupamiento de riesgos y cómo diseñar productos de seguro que aprovechen este concepto para beneficiar a ambas partes involucradas en la transacción aseguradora.
Finalmente, nos sumergiremos en temas de ética y responsabilidad en seguros, abordando principios éticos y el cumplimiento de normativas legales y regulaciones. Esto asegura que los participantes salgan del curso no solo con un sólido conocimiento técnico, sino también con una comprensión profunda de las responsabilidades éticas y legales que implica trabajar en la industria de seguros.
A lo largo del curso, se empleará una variedad de métodos de enseñanza. Esto garantiza que los participantes puedan aplicar de manera efectiva los conocimientos adquiridos en situaciones del mundo real, preparándolos para enfrentar los desafíos y oportunidades en el dinámico campo del seguro. ¡Únete a nosotros y adéntrate en el emocionante mundo de los seguros!
target_audience: Empleados de compañías de seguros.
Profesionales interesados en trabajar en seguros.
Corredores de seguros.

objectives: Define who is the Actuary

The Actuarial Profession: Historical Development of the Actuarial Profession

requirements: Basic knowledge of the principles of economics and mathematics
Basic knowledge of the principles of accounting and financial studies
courses.description:
Review of the historical development of the actuarial profession from its inception to the present.
Explain the principles and scientific concepts and ideas that underpin the actuarial studies.
Differences between the principles and the rules of practice of the actuarial profession.
Basic concepts and ideas underlying the actuarial studies – Statistics, Probability, Demography, Mathematics, Economics, etc.
Explain the standards and rules of practice of the actuarial profession depending on its development.
Reasons for conducting actuarial valuation:
•In response to legislative requirements (as in the case of social security system).
•It is useful (even necessary) to conduct actuarial valuation when there is a need to make any adjustments to the inputs or outputs of the pension system, such as increased pension.
•If you want to merge two or more pension systems in order to solve some of the financing problems or to effect financial reforms, legislative or administrative retirement funds.
Importance of conducting actuarial valuation
• Identify Financial Position.
• Diagnose & Resolve Financing problems faced by the insurance system.
•To take steps to promote and strengthen the financial position of the insurance system procedures in a timely manner.
•Ensuring the continuity of the insurance system and its sustainability for the next generations specially when adopting the policy of self-financing (as with social security and other pension funds systems).
target_audience: Insurance and social security employees
Public, private, civil, and military funds employees
General and life insurance company’s employees
Banks and financial institutions and financial investments employees

People interested in the principles and basic scientific concepts and ideas that underpin the actuarial studies

courses.title: Statistics for Financial Analysts
courses.bio: Learn Statistics, Probability, Sampling and Hypothesis Testing
requirements: No prerequisites
courses.description:
This course provides a comprehensive introduction to the fundamental concepts and techniques of statistics tailored specifically for financial analysts. Designed to meet the needs of professionals in finance, it aims to build a strong foundation in statistical methods and data analysis relevant to financial decision-making. The course covers essential topics such as measures of central tendency, measures of deviation, probability theory, normal distribution, sampling techniques, and hypothesis testing. By the end of this course, students will have the skills to analyze and interpret financial data, make informed investment decisions based on statistical reasoning, and apply statistical techniques to various financial scenarios, enhancing their analytical and decision-making abilities.
Key Topics:
Measures of Central Tendency
Measures of Deviation
Probability
Normal Distribution
Sampling Techniques
Hypothesis Testing
Learning Outcomes:
By the end of this course, students will be able to:
Understand and apply measures of central tendency and deviation.
Calculate and interpret probabilities.
Analyse data using the normal distribution and sampling methods.
Conduct hypothesis tests and make data-driven decisions.
Communicate statistical findings effectively.
Assessment Methods:
Final Quiz to test yourself.
This course is ideal for students seeking to gain a solid grounding in statistics, whether for academic advancement, research, or professional development in the field of finance.

courses.description:
Millions of students dream of winning college scholarships to help pay for the college or university of their dreams. But getting scholarships in recent years has become increasingly competitive, difficult and time-consuming, just like the college admissions process.
This course shows interested parties – including students of all ages, parents, mentors, high school counselors and college access professionals – exactly how to give students an advantage in the hunt for college scholarships. The course explains, with real-life examples and practical advice, not just how to win more free money for college, but also how to make the scholarship process faster, easier, more targeted and less stressful.
The instructor is a nationally known finance expert who draws upon her professional and personal experiences in guiding her own daughter toward winning more than $500,000 in college scholarships.
Take this information-packed course and you'll gain access to 20 lectures, including 12 videos lasting about one-hour in total, and 8 brief articles and resources that you can read, download, customize and use in your own search for scholarships. The downloads and additional reading materials provided will focus your scholarship hunt and help you earn the scholarships, grants and other resources you need to pay for college – and not have to take out huge student loans.
target_audience: This course is for high school students and their parents who are looking for scholarships as a way to lower college costs
This course would also be tremendously valuable for
- high school guidance counselors that advise teens preparing for college
- college prep and college advocacy professionals who work with 9th through 12th graders
- community advocates who help college-bound students from low-to-moderate income families
- current college students looking for scholarships to help them complete their studies

This course is not as relevant for middle school and elementary school students who are many years away from attending college. However, it can still help younger students or their parents who want to better plan

This course is not designed to tell students specific names of scholarships they should pursue (whether private or third-party scholarships, corporate scholarships or institutional scholarships from colleges and universities). However, one course resource is a list of scholarships for those of all ages and grades.

courses.description:
Auditing is the next progression in the accounting curriculum. Auditors add value to the information prepared by the financial accountants because their work makes it more reliable and trustworthy. Whether you are going into the field of auditing or are just an investor wanting to know more about the auditors report you are reading and what goes into it, this course will help.
We learn about the core financial statements themselves, the types of evidence that an auditor will gather during their review, the standards they must follow, how they document their work, and how they ultimately communicate the results.
This course is for anyone who may have felt lost in prior auditing courses and wants real life examples and a down to earth explanation, rather than something read word-for-word out of a textbook. Is this you? Then you are in the right place!
This course is taught by an instructor with over fifteen years of training experience, including corporate training, face to face instruction, and online course development. In addition to the lectures and study material common to many other courses, this course also has a downloadable textbook/study note file, along with downloadable Excel templates paired with a lecture walking through the solution once you are done. To test your knowledge of the basic concepts we also have quizzes after each section to make sure you feel comfortable with the topic before moving on to the next one.
At the end of this course, you will have a better understanding of the standards and processes of auditing. You will be able to pass that class!! Let’s get started!
target_audience: This auditing course is for anyone who wants to learn more about auditing and its relationship to accounting. This course builds upon what we have learned in the financial accounting courses and discusses how the information is reviewed to provide assurance to those that use the information. If you are taking an auditing course and are having trouble understanding the topics this course is for you. If you are looking to enhance your career by understanding more about auditing, this course is for you. This course continues on into a Part 2 where we discuss specific audit procedures for various accounts, transactions, and cycles.

courses.description:
Welcome to our finance course: The Complete Guide to Hedging Exchange Rate Risk


Did you know that the foreign exchange market (Forex or FX) is the largest financial market in the world?
Every day, trillions of dollars are traded as global currencies are bought and sold — shaping exchange rates and impacting economies across the planet.
Operating 24 hours a day on business days, the Forex market is a truly global and dynamic environment where professional financial institutions dominate trading activity.
But what really happens in the Forex market?


In this course, you’ll explore how currencies are exchanged, and how instruments like FX spot transactions, forwards, and swaps are supporting trade and investment, and used to manage currency risk.
Your learning and understanding is enhanced by the multiple choice questions for every section.
Curious to learn more? View the free accessible parts to learn more about the course roadmap and topic basket of this course.


Course roadmap and topic outline per section
Section: Getting Started with the Currency Market
Key topics: currency market organization, key participants, products, and trading motivations.
Your first step in the forex market
Section: FX market standards and conventions
Key topics: settlement timelines, ISO currency codes, FX rate quotations, spreads, and cross rates.
Your learning: confidently read, interpret, and communicate FX quotes, understand settlement rules, and navigate the conventions that underpin the global currency market.
Section: An Introduction to Currency risk & Hedging
Key topics: the main sources of currency risk exposure; a practical example hedging.
Your learning: understanding of currency risk sources and determination factors; introduction to mitigate FX risk.
Section: FX Swaps & Forwards
Key topics: currency derivatives - FX swaps and forwards
Your learning: understand and use FX swaps (structure); swap points calculation: derive FX forward rates: other FX swap variations (cross-currency interest rate swaps, basis swaps.
Section: Currency Risk Management
Key topics: the practice of managing FX risk on foreign-currency payables and receivables;
Your learning: Practical hedging techniques for protecting against exchange rate fluctuations


OUR OTHER UDEMY AVAILABLE COURSES

courses.description:
The risks faced by public and private organizations are becoming increasingly critical and complex to manage. To sustain adequate Corporate Governance, business management requires, therefore, improved tools to efficiently identify and mitigate the various types of risks that lurk.
Among such tools, it is crucial to have efficient assurance functions that are properly coordinated with each other and with the rest of the organization.
In this interesting and valuable course, we will address a strategy so that Internal Audit can rise to this challenge, coordinating and adequately arranging assurance and consulting tasks to provide comprehensive risk coverage that exceeds the usual scope of operational risk to transcend to strategic risk.
Throughout the activity we will explore a systematic methodology for the organization to identify and manage all its risks, the crucial tools for it and the appropriate internal audit strategy to initially achieve its due implementation through consulting work, and later its validation through assurance. D
We will also address the formulation of the annual internal audit plan based on risks, as well as the implications of the risk approach in the conduct of assurance assignments and specifically in each of the stages that make them up.
It is an activity of utmost importance and value for internal auditors and management and managerial functions

Explore various tools and mechanisms such as carbon markets, green bonds, and other innovative financing instruments that drive funding for climate action.

courses.description:
Welcome to the course, "Climate Finance: A Pathway towards Sustainable Development"! Let's take an interactive journey through the key topics we will explore together:
Introduction: We’ll explore the fundamentals of climate change and set the stage for understanding why climate finance is so essential. Think about the GHG sources you’re most familiar with—do you see opportunities for change?
History of Climate Finance: In this module, we’ll travel back in time to understand its evolution up to 2020, and then fast-forward to see the key developments from 2020 to 2024. And then on NCQG
Categories of Climate Finance: Mitigation, adaptation, loss, and damage—what do these mean, and why do they matter? Let’s unpack these categories and discuss real-world examples of each. Have you encountered projects in your community that address these areas?
Source of Finance: Where does the money come from? Public finance, private finance, or a mix of both (blended finance)? This module encourages you to think critically about the different funding sources. If you were a policymaker, where would you allocate resources for maximum impact?
Mechanisms of Climate Finance: Now it’s time to get hands-on with tools like carbon markets, green bonds, and other innovative financing instruments. Imagine yourself designing a financing solution—what mechanisms would you use to make it sustainable?
Conclusion: We’ll wrap up by connecting all the dots with an engaging final video. Reflect on what you’ve learned
target_audience: Environmental Professionals and Policymakers: Individuals working in climate policy, sustainability, or environmental management who want to enhance their understanding of financial mechanisms for climate action.
Academics and Students: Learners in fields such as environmental science, economics, finance, or public policy who want to gain insights into the role of finance in addressing climate challenges.
Academics and Students: Learners in fields such as environmental science, economics, finance, or public policy who want to gain insights into the role of finance in addressing climate challenges.

Non-Governmental Organizations (NGOs) and Community Leaders: Advocates and practitioners working on climate resilience, equity, and community development seeking strategies to secure funding and support for their initiatives.

requirements: No experiences needed, we will learn everything from this course
courses.description:
Hi, this is Kangxiao, I have many years of working experience with industry leaders like Paypal, Google, and Chime. Throughout my entire career, I have used data to do analysis, build models, and solve key business problems.
When I learn online, I often run into two issues:
The course offers in-depth knowledge, but it doesn't have very broad coverage. In reality, we don't need to be experts for everything. But it will give us a huge advantage if we know the basics for a lot of things.
The course focuses too much on the technical side. I find a lot of the courses focus entirely on either coding like how to write Python codes, or stats like the math behind different kinds of ML models. And there are very few courses that link payment risk/fraud, modeling, and coding together to solve real-world problems.
In the payment and payment risk industry, people have come to the conclusion that we have to rely on data-driven solutions to fight against the bad actors. This makes data science and data analytics super important for payment risk and payment fraud.


Thus, In this course, I want to share my knowledge of data science and analytics in payment risk by offering very broad coverage of payment and payment risk basics, data science, statistics, modeling, and coding, and using case studies to connect data, coding, and stats together. That’s exactly what we do in the real world, in our day-to-day work. The best talents I observe in Paypal, Google, and Chime are the ones who are really good at connecting these dots together to solve complicated problems.


I hope this course can help set you ready for your future success in payment and payment risk. Please join us, If any of these interests you. Let's enjoy this journey together!
target_audience: Beginners who want to start a career in Payment & Payment Risk
Beginners who want to do payment risk and fraud analytics
Beginners who want to do payment risk and fraud data science
Anyone who is passionate about mitigating risk and catch fraud with data

requirements: No College Degree Required
No Insurance Adjusters License Required
No Prior Insurance Experience Required
courses.description:
My name is Andrew Reddick and I've worked professionally in the Insurance industry for over 7 years. During this time I've held several roles from selling life insurance over the phone to working auto fire and theft claims for stolen Lamborghini's and by far the most rewarding role personally, professionally and financially has been that of an Auto Insurance Adjuster.
Working as an Auto Insurance Adjuster is a career path that people often overlook because it isn't talked about much and I designed this course to serve as an introduction into this fast paced, rewarding and constantly growing industry.
In this course you'll learn from start to finish what an Auto Insurance Adjuster position and completing an auto claim successfully looks like on a day to day basis. You will also have a step by step guide explaining in detail where to apply to these positions online upon completion of the course.
Additionally, you will learn how to format your resume to apply for these jobs and will know what questions you will be asked in the interview and how to answer these behavioral based questions.
Deciding to work as an Insurance Adjuster in the auto industry has been the best decision I've made for my career and has led to several promotional opportunities and this course will serve as a guide for you to achieve these same results and more.


With the purchase of the How to Become an Insurance Adjuster Part 2, you will receive the following:


- Three Modules with audio full of information you will not find anywhere else explaining Insurance claims and the Auto Adjuster role in detail to demonstrate proficiency when interviewing for these positions.
- Adjusters Handbook containing a Course Synopsis, Recorded Explanation Overview, Example Police Report, and Police Report Decoding Document.
- Adjusters workbook with exercises to be completed along with modules
- Quiz with 25+ questions to test knowledge covering three modules.
- Detailed explanation on how to perform at a high level as an Insurance Adjuster to set yourself apart from your peers.




FAQ'S
What is the Salary Range for an Adjuster Role?
The typical salary range for an auto adjuster positions can range from as low as $50,000 starting to over $70,000 per year starting.
Will I need a license to become an Auto Insurance Adjuster?
No license is needed and anyone can apply to these roles.
How long does it take to become an Auto Insurance Adjuster?
Part 1, 2 and 3 of this course can be completed in a 6 hour span. From there you can apply to Auto Insurance Adjuster Positions that same day and potentially hear back from interested employers within 72 hours of applying to schedule an interview.
Will I need to go into an office or do any in person work as an Auto Insurance Adjuster?
Most insurance companies have work from home remote positions available that they are actively hiring for. You have the option of looking into in person office positions where you may go into an office once or twice a week or work from home positions where you will work from the comfort of your home 100% of the time, the choice is yours.
Where do I apply for a job as an Auto Insurance Adjuster?
There are several places to apply for a job as an auto insurance adjuster ranging from Insurance Carrier sites to job boards. This course includes specific links containing Auto Adjuster Roles that will streamline the application process.
What type of Auto Insurance Positions are available?
There are countless entry level positions within insurance carriers that this course will provide you a baseline understanding of. This ranges from Bodily Injury Adjusting to Auto Fire and Theft Adjusting but in this course, we will focus on Auto Damage Adjusting.
Do I need a degree to become an Insurance Adjuster?
A college degree is not required to become an Insurance Adjuster, some of the best adjusters I've worked with have not had college degrees.
Do I need to have prior insurance or business related experience to become an Insurance Adjuster?
Absolutely Not, I've seen people become successful Insurance Adjusters after working in the restaurant industry, retail, education, sales, banking, fast food, just about every industry you can think of.
Can I work part time as an Insurance Adjuster?
This depends. Most Adjuster positions are full time requiring a full 40 hours a week but this isn't to say that some Insurance Carriers will not have part time positions listed. You must specify this search criteria during your job search if you are looking for part time employment after completing this course.
Is Insurance Adjusting a stable industry?
Absolutely, This is a stable and rapidly growing industry that has been around since 1897.
When will Part 3 be available?
Part 3 will be available momentarily and will cover exactly where to locate Insurance Adjuster Positions and how to interview with Insurance Companies to receive job offers.

courses.title: 2025 CFA ESG/ Sustainable Investing: Chapter-wise Qbanks- II
courses.bio: Master the 2025 CFA ESG/ Sustainable Investing Exam on your 1st Attempt: Chapter-wise Question Banks (Chapters 6–9)
courses.description:
Become a CFA ESG/ Sustainable Investing Professional (2025)
Are you preparing for the CFA ESG/ Sustainable Investing Professional exam and aiming to clear it on your first attempt?. This comprehensive, exam-focused Chapters-wise Qbanks is built for aspirants who want the most realistic, up-to-date practice available. Developed by Sustainability Mastery Academy, in consultation with experts who have successfully passed the exam, this resource combines precision content with structured practice to accelerate your journey from learning to confident mastery.
Each of the 9 modules includes 100 highly probable questions, carefully designed to mirror the actual exam pattern. Each module contains unique questions, distinct from the mock tests, to provide broader practice and enhance exam readiness. This part-II consists of following 04 chapters/ modules (Chapters 6-9) as per the curriculum:
1. Engagement and Stewardship
2. ESG Analysis, Valuation and Integration
3. ESG Integrated Portfolio Construction and Management
4. Investment Mandates, Portfolio Analytics and Client Reporting


Why This Program Delivers
Designed to eliminate repeat attempts: We understand that retaking the exam strains both finances and mental resilience. This program was co‑created and peer‑reviewed by professionals who have sat, faced, and passed the exam. Every Qbank is engineered to replicate real exam pattern, cognitive load, and disclosure decision style so you internalize exam logic before test day and maximize your probability of a first‑attempt pass.
What This Program Delivers
A tightly exam-aligned prep path for the CFA Sustainable/ESG Investing exam that builds conceptual clarity, sharpens technical application, and boosts confidence in applying ESG principles across investment decisions and portfolio construction.
Why You’ll Succeed
1. 100% syllabus alignment: Content maps directly to the current exam blueprint, building the knowledge, skills, and practical fluency needed to integrate ESG into investment decision-making and portfolio construction.
2. Free access to chapter-wise summary notes: Enroll in the chapter-wise Qbanks (both parts) to unlock/receive chapter-wise summary notes — your essential “secret sauce” for quickly grasping key points from each chapter. (Pls visit our profile page and email us to receive the chapter-wise summary notes).
3. Realistic exam style: Questions replicate the certification’s format—concept recall, scenario-based evaluation, “best action” choices, and applied judgment in investment contexts.
4. Structured learning progression: Qbanks move from foundational concepts to advanced analytical integration, sharpening both speed and investment-grade insight.
5. Lean explanations: Concise, retention-focused rationales highlight what matters for applying ESG factors in real-world investing—no fluff.
6. Clear corrective insight: Every question includes a breakdown of the right answer so you can diagnose gaps, learn from mistakes, and reinforce sound investment reasoning.
Your Next Steps
START your CFA ESG/ Sustainable Investing practice exam today—tackle every question with confidence, sharpen your expertise, and ACE the exam on your first attempt.
Enroll both parts now for all 9 Chapters: 2025 CFA ESG & Sustainable Investing Exam Prep – Chapterwise Q-Banks (I & II).
Also, level up your preparation with our 2025 CFA ESG/ Sustainable Investing Exam Prep: Mock Tests.
target_audience: This course is for anyone pursuing Sustainable / ESG certification—ESG and sustainability professionals, consultants, corporate investing teams, career changers, and graduates—seeking realistic exam practice to identify gaps and ensure first-attempt success.

Credit risk management and mitigation

requirements: No prior experience required. Basic familiarity with financial statements and Excel/Google Sheets is helpful but not mandatory.
courses.description:
Credit risk is the backbone of every lending and investment decision. Yet most professionals struggle to move beyond theory into practical application. This course bridges that gap.
You’ll learn how to evaluate borrowers using the 5 Cs of Credit, assess collateral quality, negotiate covenants, and apply advanced tools like RAROC, RORWA, PD/LGD/EAD, and CAPM. We’ll also cover portfolio diversification, structured credit, and counterparty risk—plus the global Basel Accords that shape modern banking.
Through step-by-step lessons, real case studies, and downloadable templates, you’ll gain the confidence to present credit recommendations to committees, price loans correctly, and safeguard profitability while staying compliant with regulatory frameworks.
By the end of this course, you will be able to:
Analyze financial ratios and cash flow to detect borrower red flags
Structure covenants and collateral to mitigate risk
Calculate risk-adjusted returns with RAROC and RORWA
Understand Basel III/IV capital requirements and their impact on banks
Present a professional credit memo with confidence
Whether you’re a student, junior analyst, banker, or fintech founder, this course will equip you with job-ready credit risk skills.
If you lend, invest, or ship fintech products—credit risk is the one mistake you can’t afford.
Enroll now and transform the way you understand and manage credit risk.
target_audience: Students, banking professionals, fintech founders, and aspiring credit analysts who want practical skills in credit risk management and Basel frameworks.

courses.title: How to Pay It Forward: Saving for the Purpose of Legacy

Introduction to Blessings & Philanthropy: Introduction to Philanthropy: Bless Me Account Origins
Wealth Mindset & Giving: Your Network is Your Net Worth

requirements: A beginning level of financial literacy
courses.description:
This training outlines the Bless Me Account. How are you generous and help others when you are not wealthy? Learn what you can do to organize your finances for increased philanthropy.
When it comes to personal philanthropy and giving, it's important to approach it from a faith-based perspective. This training aims to help individuals understand how to cultivate discipline and generosity to enhance their financial health and well-being, through the concept of the "Bless Me Account". Here are four objectives to guide you toward financial prosperity and a more charitable lifestyle:


Develop a mindset of generosity: Even if you don't have a lot of wealth, generosity should always be a priority. We often make the mistake of thinking that we need to wait until we are wealthy to start giving. However, the act of giving should be a regular habit, independent of your financial situation.
Cultivate financial discipline: Discipline is a critical component of personal financial management. Without discipline, it's easy to overspend and lose control of your finances. By being mindful of your spending habits and setting clear financial goals, you can stay on track and reach your financial objectives.
Build up your financial literacy: Having a solid understanding of personal finance is crucial for making informed decisions about your money. By acquiring financial knowledge and skills, you'll be better equipped to manage your wealth and increase your charitable giving.
Organize your finances for increased philanthropy: To begin your journey towards philanthropy, you first need to organize your finances effectively. This includes creating a budget, establishing financial goals, and identifying opportunities for charitable contributions. With a solid financial foundation in place, you'll have the tools and resources necessary to make a meaningful impact in your community.
By focusing on these objectives, you can create a lifestyle of financial prosperity and generosity, rooted in your faith and principles of financial literacy. Start today and unlock the true rewards of giving back to your community.
target_audience: If you are interested in creating the ability to be generous even though you are not wealthy, this course will help.
While learning about philanthropy, learn discipline, techniques, and considerations that increase your financial health and well-being.

courses.description:
In today's world, climate change is one of the most pressing global challenges, and businesses, governments, and individuals all have a role to play in reducing greenhouse gas emissions.


Our course offers a unique opportunity to learn from experts in the field, explore the latest strategies and technologies for reducing emissions, and understand the complexities of carbon markets and trading. With Carbon Learn, you'll gain a competitive advantage in a world that is rapidly transitioning to a low-carbon economy.


Module 1: Introduction to Carbon Neutrality
In this module, we will introduce you to the concept of carbon neutrality and its significance in mitigating the impact of climate change and its impact on the environment, society, and economy.


Lesson 1: Introduction to carbon neutrality and climate change
Lesson 2: Understanding Carbon Neutrality
Lesson 3: The Importance of Carbon Neutrality
Lesson 4: Implementing Carbon Neutrality in Organizations


Module 2: Carbon Footprint and Emissions Reduction
In this module, we will focus on understanding the concept of carbon footprint and explore ways to reduce greenhouse gas emissions. We will cover a range of topics, including measuring carbon footprint, identifying emission sources, and developing emissions reduction strategies.


Lesson 1: Understanding Carbon Footprint
Lesson 2: Methods of Measuring Carbon Footprint
Lesson 3: Strategies for Emissions Reduction


Module 3: Carbon Markets and Offsets:
In this module, we will explore the concept of carbon markets and how they can play a role in reducing greenhouse gas emissions. We will also discuss the use of carbon offsets as a strategy to mitigate emissions, and the challenges and controversies associated with this approach.


Lesson 1: What are Carbon Markets?
Lesson 2: What is carbon credit?
Lesson 3: VCM: main trends and challenges
Lesson 4: Emissions Trading Systems (ETSs)
target_audience: This course is ideal for those (business and individuals) who work or are involved in sustainability, environmental or energy management and for those who want to understand the pathway to carbon neutrality.

requirements: This course is structured to be accessible to a broad audience, from those new to sustainable finance to seasoned professionals seeking to deepen their expertise.

The curriculum begins by establishing core definitions and historical context, gradually building complexity. This approach lowers the barrier for beginners, allowing individuals from diverse professional backgrounds to engage effectively.

Learners should have access to a computer and a stable internet connection to participate in the online modules. No specialized software or tools are necessary beyond standard web browsing capabilities
courses.description:
In an era of accelerating climate risk, social inequality, and corporate accountability, Environmental, Social, and Governance (ESG) principles have become central to financial decision-making. This course offers a comprehensive exploration of ESG and Sustainable Finance, equipping learners with the tools to evaluate, integrate, and apply sustainability frameworks in investment and corporate strategy.
Participants will delve into the evolving landscape of ESG metrics, regulatory standards, and stakeholder expectations. Through real-world cases, the course bridges theory and practice—highlighting how capital markets can be leveraged to drive long-term value and positive societal impact.
Whether you're a finance professional, policymaker, entrepreneur, or student, this course empowers you to navigate the complexities of sustainable finance and become a catalyst for responsible growth.
Key Topics Include:
Foundations of ESG and sustainability in finance
Practical ESG Implementation Strategies for Companies
Sustainable Financial Instruments and Products
The Evolving Regulatory Landscape and Future Trends
Market Dynamics, Incentives, and Emerging Trends
Challenges, Risks, and Criticisms in Sustainable Finance
Career Opportunities and Professional Development
Who Should Enroll: Finance professionals, sustainability officers, analysts, students, and anyone seeking to align financial acumen with purpose-driven impact across the globe.

target_audience: This comprehensive course is tailored for a diverse group of professionals and aspiring individuals who recognize the transformative power of sustainable finance and ESG

Finance Professionals: Including investment analysts, portfolio managers, financial advisors, risk managers, and corporate finance specialists seeking to integrate ESG factors into their strategies and operations. The course will provide them with the knowledge to identify and manage ESG-related risks and opportunities, which are increasingly becoming material financial factors.

Business Leaders & Corporate Strategists: CEOs, Chief Sustainability Officers (CSOs), and managers across various departments (e.g., supply chain, human resources, operations) who need to embed sustainability into core business functions and drive value creation. The course emphasizes how ESG is a strategic driver, not just a compliance exercise.

ESG & Sustainability Specialists: Professionals already working in sustainability roles who wish to deepen their understanding of financial instruments, regulatory landscapes, and market dynamics to enhance their impact and career progression.

Students & Recent Graduates: Individuals pursuing careers in finance, business, environmental studies, or public policy who want to gain a competitive edge in a rapidly growing field. The course outlines high-paying job roles and essential skills for the sustainable finance sector.

Policymakers & Regulatory Professionals: Those involved in shaping financial regulations and environmental policies will gain insights into the complexities of global frameworks and the role of central banks and international organizations in driving systemic change.

Anyone Interested in Responsible Investing: Individuals who wish to understand how their investments can contribute to positive environmental and social impact while also generating financial returns.

SAP Analytics Cloud brings together analytics and planning in a single solution in the cloud. You can instantly move from insight to action, simulate any scenario for better business outcomes, and generate plans from predictions automatically to drive agile decisions.


SAP Analytics Cloud allows people from throughout an organization to use the company's analytics capabilities. The application's native language functionality makes it simple for users of all levels to gain rapid insights and better decision-making.
The learning journey is geared towards the business user, so you don't need to be a data scientist to successfully use augmented analytics in SAP Analytics Cloud. In fact, you don't need any prior AI or machine learning knowledge and it's easy to understand!


Data Preparation and Wrangling (Datasets and Models)
Learn how to prepare, enhance, and optimize your data using SAP Analytics Cloud with advanced data wrangling and data preparation workflows for both datasets and models.


Choose Between Datasets and Models
Depending of your business case, you can choose between preparing your data using a model or a dataset.
Before building your story, you need to make sure that your data is prepared for scenario analysis. With SAP Analytics Cloud’s wrangling experience, data preparation can be done using either dataset or a model.
They both offer the same level of functionalities and don’t impact the way the data is consumed in stories. However, the way you create and manage these data objects are different, as they address different purposes.


Identify Which Format Fits Best Your Needs
Datasets store data in a single table, and the semantic structure is defined by the metadata. Go for a dataset if you’re only looking to upload data, using a .csv or .xlsx file, and analyze it in a story straight away.
Models store data as a star schema, and the structure of the model is reflected in the database. Go for a model if the structure of the data is already set, or if you already have a structure in mind before importing the data to fit into the model. A model is preferred when it comes to govern the data processing, like in case of planning.


Advantages of Using a Model
Models guarantee that the data they hold follows a series of business rules that certify that workflows such as planning can be run. Changes made to the structure of the model can be done either at the structure level, if the fact table is empty, or by rebuilding the model from the original data preparation session.
Models also support row-level security, fine-grained data management of dimensions, and fact tables.


Advantages of Using a Dataset
Datasets are reactive to change, any modifications you make to the data or data structure are done simply by editing the dataset, without data loss or restriction.


About Datasets and Dataset Types
A dataset is a simple collection of data, usually presented in a table. You can use a dataset as the basis for your story, and as a data source for Smart Predict.
Dataset are first choice when you want to create story/ visualization quickly and do not want to get into structure definition, during data processing or when development do not demand IT governance. In SAP Analytics Cloud, you can encounter different types of datasets:


Standalone Datasets
This type of dataset is stored in SAP Analytics Cloud and you can find it in a folder location (for example, public, private, or workspace) on the Files page. You create them collecting your data either by importing a data file or collecting files from other systems.
target_audience: SAP S4 Hana Consultant

courses.description:
En este curso vas a aprender a elaborar diversos asientos contables de cualquier operación económica. Te enseñaré sobre los elementos contables, como el activo, el pasivo, el patrimonio, los ingresos y los gastos, presentes en toda operación económica. Una vez que hayamos repasado estos conceptos, utilizaremos un plan de cuentas (PCGE peruano en nuestros ejemplo), desarrollando los casos más comunes que se presentan en todo tipo de empresas. (más de 30 casos prácticos)
Muchas personas no comprenden la contabilidad debido a que se les enseñó de una manera errada y confusa, incluso personas que ejercen la carrera contable no tienen la comprensión de los objetivos de la dinámica contable.
Es por ello que he desarrollado un temario de 48 lecciones donde podrás comprender de una vez y para siempre sobre la contabilidad. Al finalizar este curso serás un experto en la elaboración de asientos contables y podrás darle sentido al uso de las columnas del debe y el haber.
Cabe mencionar que no es elaborado exclusivamente para contadores, sino para todo aquel que desee entender la contabilidad, es decir que cualquier persona podrá llevar este curso sin dificultades.
Te invito a que formes parte y empieces a ver la contabilidad de una forma diferente!!

objectives: Gestionar la contabilidad de costes dentro del área contable de la empresa.

Establecer precio de venta de un producto o servicio.
Calcular el margen de beneficio que aporta un producto o servicio a la empresa.
Detectar y corregir pérdidas derivadas de la venta de un producto o servicio.

requirements: Debes poder usar un PC a nivel básico.

courses.description:
¿Sabes cuánto le cuesta a tu empresa fabricar un producto o prestar un servicio? ¿Y cuántas unidades necesitas vender para empezar a ganar dinero?
En este curso práctico y claro de Contabilidad de Costes, aprenderás paso a paso a calcular tus costes reales, definir precios de venta con beneficio y analizar la rentabilidad de tu actividad. Es una herramienta fundamental para tomar decisiones empresariales con base sólida, tanto si eres estudiante como si gestionas un negocio.
¿Qué aprenderás?
A identificar y clasificar costes directos e indirectos.
A calcular el precio de venta aplicando márgenes de beneficio reales.
A determinar si tu negocio es rentable o está en pérdidas.
A estimar el punto de equilibrio: cuántas unidades necesitas vender para cubrir costes.
A realizar análisis patrimonial y financiero con lógica contable.
A aplicar métodos de valoración de existencias como FIFO y PMP.
A construir presupuestos anuales y mensuales con control de gastos e ingresos.
A elaborar y entender diferentes tipos de facturas: con impuestos, sin ellos, con descuentos y rectificativas.
A usar Excel para aplicar toda esta teoría de forma práctica y directa.
¿Qué incluye el curso?
Explicaciones claras y accesibles desde cero.
Casos prácticos resueltos paso a paso.
Supuestos finales con empresas de producto, multiproducto y servicios.
Plantillas y materiales descargables.
Acceso de por vida y soporte para resolver tus dudas.
Este curso está pensado para emprendedores, estudiantes de contabilidad o administración, autónomos y responsables financieros que quieran entender y controlar los números que realmente importan.
Controla tus costes. Decide con datos. Haz crecer tu negocio con lógica.
target_audience: Personas interesadas en optimizar los recursos de la empresa.
Emprendedores que deseen conocer cuanto les cuesta fabricar un producto o servicio.
Estudiantes de administración y/o contabilidad que deseen ampliar y afianzar conocimientos.
Personal Administrativo que quiera ampliar su formación y trabajar en el área contable de una empresa.

courses.description:
انضم إلى دورتنا التدريبية المتكاملة على Udemy لتعزيز مهاراتك وفهمك في مجال الشريعة والحوكمة في التمويل الإسلامي. إذا كنت تسعى للحصول على زمالة المراقب والمدقق الشرعي وفقًا لمعايير الإيوفي (الهيئة العامة للمحاسبة والمراجعة للمؤسسات المالية الإسلامية) أو ترغب في تحسين معرفتك في معايير الحوكمة والتدقيق، فهذه الدورة مصممة خصيصًا لك.
برنامج المراقب والمدقق الشرعي المعتمد
وهو أحد برامج الزمالة التي تقدمها هيئة المحاسبة والمراجعة للمؤسسات المالية الإسلامية. تم إطلاقه في عام 2006 ويتم حاليا تطوير محتوى البرنامج.
يتم تطويربرنامج المراقب والمدقق الشرعي المعتمد لتزويد المرشحين بالفهم التقني المطلوب والمهارات المهنية في الامتثال للشريعة والتدقيق للمصارف والمؤسسات المالية الإسلامية
يركز البرنامج بشكل عام على المعرفة والتطبيقات والممارسات العملية لتقديم تجربة تعليمية ذات جودة عالية.
مزايا زمالة المراقب والمدقق الشرعي المعتمد
-- يمكنك الحصول على المزايا التالية عند استيفاء جميع متطلبات البرنامج والانضمام الى عضوية زمالة المراقب والمدقق الشرعي المعتمد
-- استخدام لقب عضو في زمالة المراقب والمدقق الشرعي المعتمد من قبل هيئة المحاسبة والمراجعة للمؤسسات المالية الإسلامية
-- نشر اسمك وملفك الشخصي المختصر على موقع هيئة المحاسبة والمراجعة للمؤسسات المالية الإسلامية ؛
-- الاعتراف من المؤسسات المالية الدولية والهيئات التنظيمية
-- زيادة فرص العمل للعمل في المؤسسات المالية الإسلامية عبر العالم
ما ستتعلمه:
معايير الامتثال الشرعي: استكشف بعمق المبادئ الشرعية التي تحكم التمويل الإسلامي. تعلم الإطار الكامل للامتثال الشرعي بدءًا من المفاهيم الأساسية وصولاً إلى التطبيقات المتقدمة. تعرف على كيفية ضمان تطابق العمليات المالية مع القوانين والأخلاقيات الإسلامية.
متطلبات زمالة الإيوفي: احصل على رؤى شاملة حول معايير الإيفوفي للمراقبين والمدققين الشرعيين. يتناول هذا الجزء من الدورة المتطلبات الأساسية، الإرشادات الإجرائية، وأفضل الممارسات التي تحتاجها لتحقيق النجاح في مسيرتك المهنية.
معايير الحوكمة: تعلم كيف يمكن تطبيق معايير الحوكمة الفعالة في المؤسسات المالية الإسلامية. فهم كيفية تصميم وتنفيذ سياسات حوكمة تضمن الشفافية، النزاهة، والامتثال للمعايير الشرعية.
معايير التدقيق: تعمق في فهم معايير التدقيق الخاصة بالإيوفي، وتعلم كيفية إجراء مراجعات دقيقة وفعالة لضمان مطابقة العمليات المالية للمعايير الشرعية.
لماذا يجب عليك الانضمام؟
تعليم متميز: يقدم الدورة مدرب متميز ذو خبرة ومهارة في مجال التمويل الإسلامي والحوكمة، لضمان الحصول على تعليم شامل وعملي مع نسبة نجاح 100% لجميع طلابه السابقين البالغ عددهم أكثر من 300 متدرب
تدريب عملي: تضم الدورة أمثلة واقعية وتمارين عملية لتعزيز تطبيق المعرفة في مواقف حقيقية.
شهادة معتمدة: بعد إتمام الدورة، ستتمكن من الحصول على شهادة متميزة تعزز من مهاراتك وتفتح أمامك فرصًا مهنية جديدة.
انضم إلينا الآن وابدأ رحلتك نحو التميز في مجال التمويل الإسلامي والحوكمة الشرعية!
target_audience: - العاملين في القطاع المصرفي ويودون الانتقال لمجال المالية الإسلامية

courses.title: CMA Part 1 Intensive Mock Exams Review
courses.bio: CMA P1
objectives: External Financial Reporting
Budgeting Planning Strategy
Performance Management

Technology and Analytics
requirements: Graduation in any discipline
courses.description:
The Certified Management Accountant (CMA) designation is a globally recognized professional credential in the field of management accounting and financial management. To earn the CMA designation, candidates must pass two rigorous exams: CMA Part 1 and CMA Part 2.
CMA Part 1, also known as the Financial Reporting, Planning, Performance, and Control exam, is the first step in the CMA certification process. This exam primarily focuses on core accounting and financial management concepts. In a nutshell, CMA Part 1 covers the following key areas:
External Financial Reporting Decisions: This section covers the preparation of financial statements, including income statements, balance sheets, and cash flow statements. It also addresses the principles of revenue recognition, income measurement, and valuation of assets and liabilities.
Planning, Budgeting, and Forecasting: This segment delves into the budgeting process, variance analysis, and forecasting techniques, helping professionals make informed decisions about resource allocation and performance evaluation.
Performance Management: Here, candidates learn about performance measurement, cost management, and the evaluation of various metrics and key performance indicators to monitor and improve organizational performance.
Cost Management: This section focuses on cost terminology, cost behavior, cost-volume-profit analysis, and various costing methodologies to assist in effective decision-making and control.
CMA Part 1 is designed to test candidates' knowledge and skills related to these fundamental concepts, and it is a computer-based exam consisting of multiple-choice questions, essay questions, and quantitative analysis problems. It's important for candidates to have a solid understanding of these topics to pass the exam successfully. Once candidates pass both CMA Part 1 and Part 2, they can proudly bear the CMA designation, signifying their expertise in financial and management accounting.
target_audience: Students pursuing CMA USA certification

Mi nombre es Juan Carlos Fernández Alemán, tengo 22 años en Corretaje de Seguros, tengo más de 20.000 pólizas vendidas en el mercado local e internacional, vengo de 3 generaciones en el corretaje de seguros y hoy quiero hablarte del mercado asegurador.
Hemos diseñado este curso para que tu puedas triunfar en el mercado asegurador, un mercado super competido y espectacular, porque te permite viajar y codearte con gente importante en cualquier parte del mundo.
Acá te vamos a dar todas las claves para que tengas éxito, para que tu carrera sea mucho más fácil y puedas lograr las metas con una cartera de seguros sólida que se renueve todos los años en un 90%.
En este curso te vamos a dar todas las herramientas, desde la presentación personal, las redes sociales, cómo crear tu marca, cómo ser exitoso, cuál son las claves para serlo, qué tienes que saber de seguros y de reaseguros. Todas las dudas te las vamos a aclarar en este curso y te vamos a decir, cómo hacer networking, cómo hacer rapport, cómo llegarle a los clientes, cómo cerrar más clientes y cómo renovarlos.
¡Inscríbete ya en este curso!
Este es el mejor curso para vendedores de seguros.
target_audience: Va dirigido a todo público, sin importar tu profesión o a lo que te dediques actualmente.
La carrera del corredor de seguros puede arrancar a cualquier edad y al ritmo que desees.
Si necesitas un Plan B en tu vida, este es el camino.

courses.title: NRI to Resident: Essential Financial Transition Blueprint
courses.bio: Only Financial Planning Playlist Designed for Returning NRIs
objectives: Develop a complete pre-departure financial strategy - Create a step-by-step timeline covering cost-of-living analysis, fund requirements planning, and essential
Master RNOR tax optimization and timing strategies - Understand how to qualify for and maximize Resident but Not Ordinarily Resident status to legally minimize
Strategically manage U.S. retirement accounts with 5 different options - Learn advanced penalty free withdrawal strategies including 72(t) SEPP, Rule of 55
Navigate Social Security benefits and cross-border taxation - Understand how to qualify and receive Social Security retirement/spousal/disability benefits
Make informed decisions about U.S. assets and property - Analyze whether to sell or rent U.S. house, manage HSA accounts strategically, and brokerage accounts
Complete proper exit compliance and documentation - Master the filing of Form W-8BEN, account closure procedures, and all necessary legal/tax notifications to a

Big Picture Awareness - Are you Financia: Are you Financially Ready for Returning to India?
Is Investing in 401k Worth it if you are moving back to India?
The Must-Do Checklist Before Leaving: Financial Planning Checklist for NRIS Moving Back to India
Understanding RNOR – The Hidden Tax Adva: NRI Returning to India? You Need to Know About RNOR for Tax Planning
Social Security Strategy for Returnees: Can You REALLY Get Social Security Retirement Benefits Living in India?
How US Social Security Benefits are Taxed for NRI's Moving Back to India?
Returning to India? Don't MISS OUT on Social Security Spousal Benefits!
What Happens to Social Security SURVIVOR BENEFITS After Moving to India?
401k and IRA Decisions – Avoiding Penalt: Moving to India? 5 BEST Options for 401k Funds
Use 72(t) for Penalty FREE 401k or IRA Withdrawal
The Rule of 55 SECRET to Avoiding HUGE 401k Withdrawal Penalties
What to Do With Your HSA (Health Savings: How Health Savings Account Works and What to Do with Funds When Moving to India
Real Estate – Sell or Rent?: Returning NRIs, Should You Sell or Rent Your House When Moving Back to India?
Final U.S. Exit – Wrap Up Paperwork Prop: How to Fill Out Form W-8BEN CORRECTLY? When Leaving the US

requirements: People who have lived in US and considering moving back to India
courses.description:
Planning to return to India as an NRI involves far more than booking a flight home — it requires a carefully structured financial strategy.
Many returning NRIs unintentionally lose significant amounts to avoidable tax penalties, miss out on valuable benefits like the RNOR (Resident but Not Ordinarily Resident) tax window, and make suboptimal decisions regarding their 401(k), Social Security, and overseas assets. These are not just oversights — they’re consequences of lacking a comprehensive and timely roadmap.


This professionally designed video series provides clear, step-by-step guidance to help you:
Optimize the timing of your return to minimize tax exposure
Leverage RNOR status for tax-efficient repatriation
Navigate U.S.-based accounts such as 401(k)s, IRAs, and Social Security
Align with FEMA and Indian tax laws to stay compliant and avoid penalties
Rebuild your financial life in India with confidence and foresight
Whether you’re in the early planning stages or just months away from moving, this course equips you with the knowledge and structure needed to make informed, strategic decisions.
Prepare the right way — with clarity, confidence, and a proven roadmap.
It's not just about what to do — it's about what to do first, what to avoid, and how to think long-term. Watch now and move forward with clarity and confidence.
target_audience: This playlist is specifically designed for NRIs living in the U.S. who are planning to move back to India and want to avoid expensive financial mistakes during their transition.

Perfect for you if: You have U.S. assets like 401k, IRA, HSA, or real estate and need to handle them strategically You're overwhelmed by the complexity of cross-border financial planning and tax implications You want to maximize benefits like RNOR status and Social Security while avoiding penalties
Not suitable if: You've never lived in the U.S. as an NRI or don't have U.S. financial accounts You're looking for basic investment advice rather than India-specific transition planning

courses.title: [전 사원 회계 알기 프로젝트] 회계로운 직장생활
courses.bio: 회계 언어의 표현식인 재무제표를 읽을 수 있으며, 이를 분석할 수 있습니다. 회계어의 습득을 통해 회사 내에서 업무 진행 시 원활한 의사소통을 할 수 있게됩니다.
objectives: 회계 언어의 표현식인 재무제표를 읽을 수 있으며, 이를 분석할 수 있다.
회계어의 습득을 통해 회사 내에서 업무 진행 시 원활한 의사소통을 할 수 있다.
조직원으로서 기본이 되는 회사와 회계의 관계와 그 기본원리를 알 수 있다.
회계의 정보요소 및 회계처리 등의 분석으로 주요 의사결정에 활용할 수 있다.

재무상태표와 손익계산서는 따로 놀지 않는다: 결산한 손익은 주주의 몫 나타내는 자본으로 향한다
4단계 손익 산출해보기: 영업팀 급여는 판관비에, 생산팀 급여는 매출원가와 재고자산에
가만 앉아 있어도 수익과 비용이 발생한다-환율 관련 손익
업종별 실제 기업 손익계산서 분석: 이커머스 기업, 판매방식 바꿨더니 매출성장 착시
매출원가50%도 안되는 제약회사, 영업이익률 뚝 떨어지는 이유
유형자산의 감가상각비와 손상차손: 농사꾼 갑수가 트랙터를 샀을 때 비용처리은 언제 하나?
제품 안 팔리는데, 감가상각비에 손상차손까지 '엎치고 덮치고'
무형자산에 대한 이해와 손익반영 원리: 미사일 상표권, 매입 6개월 뒤부터 비용 반영하는 이유는?
신차 연구개발에 쓴 돈의 절반, 일단 비용 아닌 자산으로
자산 부채의 개념과 거래의 좌우균형 등식: 호떡장수에게서 미리 받은 밀가루 값은 왜 부채가 될까?
누구에게,언제,얼마를 줘야할지 정확하게 몰라도 빚이 된다
매출채권의 손상, 지분법 회계 원리: 판매대금 떼일 것 같으면 대손충당금을 활용하라
관계기업 주식,주가 아무리 올라도 손익에 기여 못해요
현금흐름과 회전율: 돈 한 푼 안 들어와도 손익계산서에는 이익이 찍힌다
얼마나 빨리 팔고 얼마나 빨리 회수하는가

requirements: 예비 신입사원부터 모든 직장인의 필수 회계 지식을 학습하고자하는 누구나 수강할 수 있습니다.
courses.description:
회알못(회계를 알지 못하는 사람)들이 번번이 회계공부에 실패하는 이유는!
회계공부를 아무리 해도 제자리걸음인 건! 당신 잘못이 아니다!
회계 원리는 아주 단순하다. ‘자산=부채+자본’이라는 간단한 원리에서 출발한다. 초급에서 고급 회계까지 이 원리가 통하지 않는 회계 처리는 없다. 본 과정은 ‘회계항등식’이라 불리는 이 원리가 다양한 상황에서 변주되는 모습을 보여준다.
회계 공부를 시작한 단계에서 과부하를 일으킬 게 뻔한 내용은 과감히 걷어냈다.
지금도 여전히 많은 회계 초보자들이 좌절감을 맛보면서도 희망을 놓지 못하고 있다. 본 과정은 이들을 위해 회계 기초 체력을 확실하게 키울 수 있는 ‘진짜 입문서’를 제공하고자 한다.


학습내용:
1. 재무상태표와 손익계산서는 따로 놀지 않는다
2. 4단계 손익 산출해보기
3. 업종별 실제 기업 손익계산서 분석
4. 유형자산의 감가상각비와 손상차손
5. 무형자산에 대한 이해와 손익반영 원리
6. 자산 부채의 개념과 거래의 좌우균형 등식
7. 매출채권의 손상, 지분법 회계 원리
8. 현금흐름과 회전율
target_audience: 회계 관련 기초 지식을 쌓고자 하는 모든 임직원
직장과 개인 모든 생활에서 회계마인드를 향상시키고자 하는 모든 임직원

My name is Erik Wray. I have been renting out RV's for over 10 years now. I currently have a travel trailer that I market and rent out in Southern California and want to show you how you can do the same with any type of RV, anywhere in the world...
This course will teach you a variety of tools, tips, and tricks that will focus on four main course objectives:


Picking the perfect RV:  Depending on your family, financial situation and a host of other things we will talk about selecting the right RV for you.  We will cover pricing and marketing strategies.
Where to list your RV:  We will cover all the sites and locations you could potentially make rental income from and the pro's and con's to each place.
How to List your RV:  There will be examples of photos, descriptions and up-sells to make you listing stand out among the rest.
How to deal with clients:  How to talk to, handle and get your RV in the hands of the client and get them on the road safely and comfortably.


There is something for everyone in this course, from the person considering buying their first RV to those with multiple RV's and experience, this course is for you.
I will share with you my years of practical experience in what works and what doesn't. You will learn:
Proper attitude and mindset.
How to make your RV Rental Ready to maximize results for as little money as possible!
An in-depth study of multiple Online Advertising websites to get your property exposed to thousands of renters in your local area. I will show you EXACTLY how to prepare the perfect advertisement and on what sites to post it on.
What to do before, during, and after the rental.


I am excited to share my knowledge with you!

courses.title: Financial Translation
courses.bio: Introduction to Financial Translation English < > Spanish
objectives: Learn how to become a financial translator
Know how to get good clients in this field
Know about the main criticalities of financial translation
Learn about the different types of financial statements
Learn how to translate basic financial and accounting terms from English to Spanish

The Company / La Empresa: High Frequency Trading - Trading de Alta Frecuencia
Financial Statements / Estados Financier: Income Statement / Profit and Loss Account
Income Statement / Profit and Loss Account
Income Statement - Profit and Loss Account
Financial Statements samples with Spanish translation

requirements: Functional knowledge of English
Intermediate level of Spanish
courses.description:
Learn the basic concepts behind financial translation and start specializing in a high-demand sector.
Introduction to Financial Translation English <>Spanish is intended for translators and financial professionals who wish to acquire both technical knowledge and language skills.
The course aims to introduce you to the skills and techniques which you need to understand and translate financial and accounting documents.
There are more than 500 million Spanish speakers as a first or second language, and 20 million Spanish students as a foreign language. Spanish is one of the six official languages of the United Nations, and it is used as an official language by the European Union and Mercosur. It is also the second most spoken language in the United States, where financiers with language skills are very sought after professionals.
The course will cover the key areas encountered by financial professionals, translators, proofreaders and writers. We will focus on some general accounting and financial topics that impact all companies, individuals and institutions, as well as specific topics of interest to financial translation.
This course is taught in English, but It provides a glossary at the end of each lecture with all the terms translated and spoken in Spanish. It also provides listening exercices in English and Spanish about topical financial issues.
Although this course is designed for people with little or no understanding of accounting and finance, financial professionals will have the opportunity to learn -and practice- financial vocabulary in Spanish.
Issues such as the nature of finance, financial translation criticalities, accounting, stakeholders, cultural adaptation or legal forms are discussed. The course also covers basic accounting documents, financial statements and the translation of its terms.
You'll find several quizzes that will help you to reinforce what you have learned in the lecture. Useful examples of financial statements translations are also provided.
By the end of the course you should have a basic level of competence which will enable you to enter a high-demand market with confidence.
target_audience: Translators
Financiers
CFOs
Accountants and bookkeepers
Financial Senior Technicians
MBAs
Journalists
CFA Candidates
Graduate students in Finance
Graduate students in economics

courses.title: Beginners Course to CORPORATE FINANCE for START-UPS [2023]
courses.bio: Introduction to the Why, What, How & Who in Corporate Finance of a Start-Up business
objectives: Understand the importance of bookkeeping in financial management and its role in organizing financial information.
The benefits of outsourcing accounting services and why to effectively communicate financial information to an external accounting team.
Importance of of cash flow monitoring and burn rate analysis in managing rapid expense growth and limited funds.
The significance of establishing basic rules and procedures to improve organizational structure and protect against fines, lawsuits and undesired behavior
Understand the role of external tax, accounting, and legal experts in ensuring compliance with legal and regulatory frameworks.
The benefits of commercial banking services for startup businesses and how to choose an appropriate startup business account.
The basics of seed capital, startup capital, and early stage capital, and how to evaluate potential investors.
Understand the role of the Big 4 accounting firms in financial statement assurance, audits, due diligence, valuation, and strategic planning.
The various investment banking services available, including capital markets, equity and debt offerings, private placements, mergers and acquisitions (M&A)
The benefits of consulting services for startups, including expertise and experience, tailored solutions to business challenges, and access to networks
requirements: No Requirements - Designed for Beginners
courses.description:
Hello, welcome, and thank you for coming to check out my Beginners Course to Corporate Finance for Startups.
If you are interested in starting your own business, or working in the corporate world, but feel overwhelmed by all the jargon and terminology, yet at the same time want to learn more about corporate finance but don't know where to start, then look no further.
I have created this beginner friendly course to serve as an introductory overview of the corporate and financial world, designed to cover all the basics, from the why, what, how and who are involved, in order to give you a better understanding of how it all fits together.
Company Life Cycle Model
The course is a part of what is known as the Company Life Cycle Model that explores each of the 5 main phases that categorize companies.
This includes:
The Adoption Phase that facilitates Start-up companies, which is what this course is all about.
Then there are the other 4 phases that aren’t part of this course, but I want to mention them to you so that you can get a good understanding of the overall grand scheme of things:
The Fast Growth Phase in which start-up companies take the next step as a Growing Firm.
The Profitability Phase where a small to medium sized firm expands on its journey to being an Enterprise.
The Large Scale Phase where the firm scales from being a small enterprise to a large enterprise.
Then lastly, the Restructuring Phase, where a Distressed Firm takes action to make vital changes in operation in order to either resurrect itself, or close its doors.
Types of Activities
Each of these phases is then divided into the types of activities that occur within a company no matter what phase they are in.
This is split into two main sections being:
Internal Activities.
External Activities.
Within Internal Activities we have the following activities:
Corporate Finance; which is the management of the financial resources and capital structure of the business, including handling funds, making investment decisions, and managing risks.
Compliance; which is the company's adherence to relevant laws, regulations, and standards in its operations, activities, and transactions.
Then within External Activities we have the following:
Commercial Banking; which are the services and products provided by a financial institution to help manage their financial transactions, such as accepting deposits, providing loans, and facilitating payments.
Investment Firms; which are financial institutions that provide funding and support to startup companies in exchange for an ownership stake or equity in the company.
The Big 4; who are highly regarded companies that offer impartial assurance and consulting services, including due diligence, valuation, M&A advisory, forensics, prospectus preparation, post-merger integration, and more.
Investment Banking; which involves providing financial advisory services, such as capital raising and M&A, to facilitate the growth and success of the company
Consulting; which refers to the professional guidance and support provided by external experts to help the company with various aspects of business operations, strategy, and growth.
In this course we will dive deeper by taking a closer look at all seven of these internal and external activities during the Adoption phase and how they pertain to start-up companies.
What You'll Learn
Ok, so what exactly will you learn?
Corporate Finance
Well; we will start with Internal Corporate Finance. Here you'll learn about monitoring expenses, as well as keeping track of available funds, and identifying any financial issues early on.
We’ll then talk about what some of the responsibilities are to achieve this including bookkeeping, accountant communications, and cash flow monitoring. From there we explore some of the spreadsheet and accounting software options available to startups, as well as the roles involved in the process.
Compliance
Next up is compliance, where we'll discuss why it's important to research tax and legal frameworks within the jurisdictions that the business operates and in doing so, establish basic rules and procedures that will aid in protecting the startup company from fines and lawsuits.
Commercial Banking
From here we move into the external section, where we'll dive into Commercial Banking. You'll learn about startup business accounts and the roles of the founder and external advisors.
Then, we'll explore Investment Firms and their role in funding the start of your business, including the types of capital available to you.
We’ll also discuss other related topics such as comparable analysis, and valuation methods, as well as what options are available to you when trying to raise capital.
Big 4
We’ll also briefly cover the Big 4 accounting firms, where you'll learn about financial statement assurance and the services they provide.
Investment banking
Investment Banking is also on the agenda, where we'll talk about the types of possible services they can offer a start-up company.
Consulting
Finally, we'll explore consulting companies, and the services and benefits that they could possibly offer, including providing expertise and experience, tailored solutions to business challenges, and access to networks and resources.
Disclaimer
Before finishing off, I want to be transparent and clear that this course is for absolute beginners in the field.
It's also important to understand that it does not teach you the intricate details on topics such as “how to start a business”, “how to manage your finances”, “how to work with spreadsheets” or even “how to get funding”.
Instead my course serves as a guide that outlines the possibilities available to a start-up company in the adoption phase of the Company Life Cycle Model.
It is designed to help you familiarize yourself with some of the jargon and terminology in the corporate world, allowing you to better understand what's out there and how it all fits together so that you can make informed decisions on what to learn next or who and why you should approach them.
So if these are topics that you are already familiar with, then this course is most likely not a good fit for you.
However, if this is something you want to learn more about and are starting from a beginner's standpoint then this course is definitely not something that you want to miss out on.
I want you to enjoy the course while learning something new along the way.
Hope to see you there!
target_audience: Entrepreneurs, startup founders, and small business owners who are seeking to better understand the financial aspects of running a business.
Those who have limited or no prior experience in corporate finance, but who understand the importance of financial management of a business.
Learners who are interested in improving their financial literacy
Anyone wanting to start a career in corporate finance

requirements: No prior experience or knowledge required. Learning will be delivered in bite sized lessons via a qualified Further Education tutor (PCET PGCE) and Accounting Professional (MAAT FdA).

courses.description:
Captions: English, বাংলা, Français, Русский, 简体中文, Española, 한국인, Polski, Português (Portugal), Türkçe
Please note to international students, this course relates to the UK PAYE System.
Maybe you would like to learn how to process your own payroll, or you work in Accounts & Payroll and need some training, or are a student interested in getting into the field. Whatever your level of experience or need, The Salary Cloud is equipped to advance and progress you.


Training can be delivered by a qualified Association of Accounting Technician (MAAT) professional, with Education 16+ Teaching Status (PCET) with over 23 years experience gained via the Private Sector, Local Government Authority and the NHS. Not only will you receive sound theoretical knowledge, but you will also gain the value and benefit of being taught the subject with real life knowledge and experience exemplars and industry recognised software, so you can use your new found knowledge for the purpose you desire.


What You'll Learn


You'll learn from the very start, with a presumption of no prior experience or knowledge, and you will be introduced to key terms and concepts. You'll learn the major components and principles of the PAYE UK Payroll system along with key laws and regulations.


How Will I Learn?


As an experienced Educational Trainer, you will be taught in a manner that will embed learning with the minimal effort on your part. Online quizzes and resources (backed up with PDF copies) will be provided so that you have immediate access and assessment outcome. Some of the resources may include:


In-lesson Activities
Multiple Choice Questioning
True/False Statements
Matching Questions
Written Responses
Flashcards
Learn Activity
Games (e.g. Gravity and Match).
You will be continuously tested as you run through the course, so don't be surprised if you come across a prior topic quiz to keep you and your understanding fresh.


Why This Course?


Quite simply, this course is flexible, affordable and relevant. Payroll is a fluid subject due to constant governmental changes and requirements, so this course has been designed to fit this fluidity. The content is based on 2022/2023 tax year and will be updated as the years progress. If you want a complete course that is interactive, up to date and relevant, then look no further.


Also, as a student, your feedback is of high importance to the building of this course, so if there are any areas you feel can be added to or improved, please get in touch as your suggestions will help grow.
target_audience: Students new to Payroll and interested in the subject.
Accounts and Finance personnel wanting Payroll knowledge for their employment.
AAT Member refresh and Continued Professional Development (CPD)
Business Owners wanting to bring Payroll In-house.
New Employers having to employee individuals for the first time.
