courses.description:
This course will discuss short term financing options from a corporate finance perspective.
We will include many example problems, both in the format of presentations and Excel worksheet problems. The Excel worksheet presentations will include a downloadable Excel workbook with at least two tabs, one with the answer, the second with a preformatted worksheet that can be completed in a step-by-step process along with the instructional videos.
Learners will understand accounts payable and trade credit as options from the perspective of short-term financing. A company’s cash management and financing strategy related to accounts payable would generally be to extend payment terms as long as possible without incurring penalties or straining the relationship with vendors.
We will also discuss credit options from a bank and commercial paper financing. When considering short-term credit options from a bank the company will want to consider the cost of the loan, the interest charged. One type of short-term loan is a term loan, credit often extended for one to seven years. Term loans are often repaid in monthly or quarterly installments.
Commercial paper is generally a short-term unsecured promissory note. Usually issued to the public in $25,000 minimum units.
This course will consider collateral as it relates to short-term financing. Collateral generally represents some form of asset securing the loan. Collateral may be used when a bank believes the loan is a higher risk.
We will also discuss accounts receivable and inventory financing.
target_audience: Finance students
Business professionals

courses.description:
The funding environment is going through major changes. The recent closure of USAID is the tip of the iceberg. Before the closure, many funders had already reduced their official development aid commitments. Donor-dependent organisations like NGOs spread across Africa are the most affected. The need for innovative funding models has never been more urgent. This masterclass series is designed to empower fundraisers within NGOs and other nonprofits to harness increased giving by individuals. This series tackles the urgent question: What comes next after the aid cuts?
Join us as we explore innovative approaches to funding and building resilient organisations. Drawing on SIVIO Institute’s groundbreaking experiments with non-traditional funding, we’ll focus on unlocking the power of individual giving. We note that this could be the best opportunity to pivot towards individual giving for several reasons including;
Africa's rising middle class located within the continent and in the diaspora,
Unprecedented growth and highest penetration of mobile-based fintech across Africa
Increased interest in public issues amongst African citizens based on the numbers that have engaged directly with public policy-related issues and the number of NGOs that have so far successfully raised resources from individuals
An emerging consensus around the need for homegrown solutions
This masterclass provides you with insights and strategies to:
Transition from the old and embrace new funding opportunities.
Reimagine your organisation's resource mobilisation model.
Communicate impact in a way that attracts resources
Establish an ecosystem to support individual giving
Turn individual generosity into a cornerstone of organisational sustainability
This masterclass is more than just a series of lessons—it's a call to action, a conversation about shaping the future of NGOs.
target_audience: Non Profit Leaders
Fundraisers
NGO Leaders

Foundations of Credit Scores & CIBIL Rep: Foundations of Credit Scores & CIBIL Reports (Basics)
Deep Dive into Score Calculation & CIBIL: Deep Dive into Score Calculation & CIBIL Consumer Report Sections
Spotting Red Flags & Hidden Patterns in: Spotting Red Flags & Hidden Patterns in CIBIL Reports

requirements: Ideal for bankers, NBFC professionals, credit analysts, or finance students. Basic knowledge of lending will be useful but not mandatory.
courses.description:
Every year, hundreds of Bankers, NBFC professionals & Credit Managers face suspensions, disciplinary actions, and audit queries. Do you know the biggest reason?

Wrong lending decisions primarily due to poor CIBIL analysis.

Most officers stop at the score. Some only look at overdue. But hidden inside every CIBIL report are red flags, repayment patterns, and behavioral signals that can make or break your career.
That’s why I designed this CIBIL Analysis Masterclass- a complete, step-by-step training program where you’ll not just “read” reports, but decode them like a seasoned Loan & Advances Officer or Credit Manager.
In this course, you will:
Understand the foundations of credit scores and how they are calculated.
Learn how to interpret DPD grids, enquiries, guarantor exposures, and utilization ratios.
Spot hidden red flags—settlements, write-offs, COVID restructurings, credit-hungry behavior.
Practice with real consumer and commercial CIBIL case studies (step-by-step analysis).
Build the confidence to defend your credit note in front of committees, auditors, and vigilance teams.
By the end of this course, you’ll have a career shield -the ability to identify risks early, safeguard your portfolio, and protect yourself from suspensions, audit penalties, and accountability cases.
So, if you are a Banker, NBFC professional or Credit Officer or finance preparing for JAIIB/CAIIB or promotion interviews—this masterclass is your ultimate toolkit to master CIBIL analysis and grow fearlessly in your career.
target_audience: Bankers, NBFC professionals, and credit officers seeking to master consumer & commercial CIBIL analysis.
Students preparing for JAIIB, CAIIB, or credit appraisal roles who want practical CIBIL case study training.
Finance professionals aiming to improve risk analysis, loan appraisal, and audit-proof decision-making skills.
Anyone curious about decoding credit scores, spotting hidden red flags, and making smarter lending decisions.

courses.title: Financial Management | الإدارة المالية
courses.bio: دورة الإدارة المالية لرواد الأعمال بطريقة عملية ومباشرة ، لإكتساب المهارات اللازمة لإدارة موارد الشركة بكفاءة
objectives: كيفية تنظيم وإدارة الميزانية لتحقيق أهداف مشروعك
فهم قائمة الدخل وإعدادها عمليًا مع مثال واقعي
تعلم كيفية قياس أرباح وخسائر مشروعك السنوية عبر الموازنة العامة
تعلم أساسيات التحليل المالي لتقييم أداء الشركات
تعلم وضع خطة مالية استراتيجية لإدارة الموارد والتدفقات النقدية بنجاح واستدامة
requirements: لا يوجد
courses.description:
وصف الدورة:
تأخذك هذه الدورة في رحلة عملية لفهم أساسيات الإدارة المالية للمشاريع والشركات الناشئة. ستتعلم كيفية تحليل البيانات المالية، التخطيط المالي، إدارة التدفقات النقدية، ومراقبة الميزانية بطريقة عملية وسهلة التطبيق. كما توفر الدورة أمثلة ونماذج تطبيقية تساعدك على اتخاذ قرارات مالية دقيقة ومدروسة تضمن نمو مشروعك واستدامته.


هدف الدورة:
تهدف هذه الدورة إلى تمكين المشاركين من فهم علم التسويق بشكل شامل وتطبيقه عمليًا، سواء في المشاريع الخاصة أو المؤسسات، مع التركيز على الابتكار وتطوير مهارات الإدارة التسويقية لتحقيق نتائج ملموسة وزيادة المبيعات ، بناء البراند ونجاح مستدام.


محتوى الدورة:

استعد لاكتشاف عالم المال من خلال 6 محاضرات متنوعة تغطي جميع الجوانب الأساسية لتطوير مهاراتك وتحقيق نتائج ملموسة:


- مقدمة في الادارة المالية.
- الميزانية (Budget)
- قائمة الدخل.
- الموازنة العامة. (Balance sheet)
- التحليل المالي.
- قائمة الدخل باستخدام برنامج الإكسل


:هذه الدورة مخصصة لـ
هذه الدورة مناسبة لرواد الأعمال والمستثمرين الجدد، وتساعدك على تحويل الموارد المالية إلى أدوات فعّالة لدعم نجاح مشروعك وتحقيق أهدافك الاستثمارية بثقة واحترافية.


هدف المحتوى التعليمي باللغة العربية:
هذه الدورة مقدمة باللغة العربية ، التقديم والمحتوى ، حيث نسعى من خلال هذا المحتوى إلى تعريب الإدارة وتبسيط مفاهيمها، ليتمكن الجميع من تعلمها بسهولة وفعالية، بغض النظر عن خلفيتهم التعليمية. كما تهدف الدورة إلى تعزيز المحتوى العلمي للطلاب وتمكينهم من اكتساب مهارات عملية تساعدهم في تطوير أنفسهم وتحقيق النجاح في حياتهم المهنية.


مقدم هذه الدورة:
يقدم هذه الدورة أ.م. خبيب الأسود، استشاري الإدارة والتسويق، ومطور شركات، ومدرب معتمد في إدارة الأعمال، الحاصل على البكالوريوس في الهندسة المدنية والماجستير في إدارة الأعمال من ألمانيا، ويتمتع بخبرة واسعة في التدريب النظري والعملي في عدة دول وبثلاث لغات.


أتمنى لكم تجربة تعليمية متميزة وناجحة!، وفي حال رغبتم بالتواصل معي، يمكنكم التواصل في أي وقت عبر حسابي على موقع يودمي.


أ.م. خبيب الأسود
استشاري الإدارة والتسويق
target_audience: أصحاب الشركات ورواد الأعمال

courses.title: SAP Vendor Invoice Management(VIM) by OpenText
courses.bio: SAP Finance Vendor Invoice Management, Open text VIM, Account payable automation - Basic to Advanced Level Course
objectives: Understand the SAP Vendor Invoice Management(VIM) process and solutions.
Knowledge and confidence to implement SAP VIM independently in a real-time project.
Understand key technical concepts ( apart from the business processes ) like DP, Process types, Process options , Roles etc., able to start the configuration immediately.

VIM Overview: VIM PO Invoice Processing in S4 HANA - Example
VIM Non-PO Invoice Processing in S4 HANA - Example
VIM Baseline Configuration: VIM Early Archiving and BC inbound Configuration - Part 1
VIM Early Archiving and BC inbound Configuration - Part 2
VIM Early Archiving and BC Inbound - Testing the configuration
VIM Document Processing: DP Document Types - Deep Dive with Configuration
DP Process Options Configuration and Usage
DP Process Types Configuration and Significance
DP Document Type, Process Type and Process Options - Test Data

requirements: SAP Account payable and Invoice verification process. SAP Workflow basic understanding.
SAP MM knowledge
Get Access to an SAP IDES System with VIM add-on ( Neither Udemy nor I are authorized to provide you with the same )
courses.description:
** Disclaimer ** -
I do NOT do Live Training. SAP is a registered trademark of SAP AG in Germany and many other countries. I am NOT associated with SAP or Opentext.
SAP software and SAP GUI are proprietary SAP software. Neither Udemy nor me are authorized to provide SAP Access. You can officially get SAP Access to practice on SAP system from SAP's website. I am not allowed by Udemy to place a link here. Please google "SAP Access" and you can find the URL for the same.
** End of Disclaimer **


OpenText Vendor Invoice Management is an add-on solution to SAP S/4HANA on Premise to provide automation of invoice processing, routing of invoice exceptions, managing of processing rules, and monitoring of process flows.
By implementing Vendor Invoice Management (VIM), companies achieve the following:
• Acceleration of AP operations across the enterprise
• Optimal integration of an invoice automation solution into SAP S/4HANA on Premise
• Higher productivity in Accounts Payable and increased flexibility in cash management by reducing the time until invoices are free for payment
• Improved supplier relations through fast and accurate invoice processing
• Accurate, on-time financial reporting with integrated access to AP information
• Regulatory compliance through a well-managed process using pre-configured rules, roles, and actions considering country-specific regulations


Students will learn everything in this course, starting from the process flow to become an implementation consultant.
target_audience: SAP FICO Consultant
SAP MM Consultant
SAP Workflow Consultant
Anyone who has basic SAP knowledge and good background in account payable process

requirements: Ön muhasebe konusunda başlangıç düzeyinde bilgi sahibi olması yeterlidir.
courses.description:
Merhaba, Logo Tiger ile ilgili güzel bir eğitim hazırlamaya çalıştım. Eğitim temel düzeyde muhasebe bilgisi gerektiriyor. Bu nedenle eğer konular seni zorlarsa yine bu platformda yer alan ön muhasebe eğitimlerine göz atabilirsin. Sonrasında bu eğitim çok daha verimli olacaktır. Logo Tiger bir ERP yazılımı olması sebebiyle muhasebe programlarına göre daha üst seviyededir. Menü mantığını anlamak zaman alabilir. Bu nedenle bu eğitim önemli konularda nokta atışı bilgiler içermektedir. Sizden ricam şudur ki, hiç bir konuyu hızlı geçmeyin. Ve eğitimi en az bir kaç kez tekrar edin. Böylece çok daha anlaşılır bir eğitim olacak ve size yarar sağlayacaktır. Eğitimin çok iyi bir eğitim olması sana da bağlı. Bu konuda senden yardım istiyorum. Eğitim ile ilgili düşüncelerini benimle paylaşırsan kesinlikle söylediklerini dikkate alacağımdan emin olabilirsin. Belki de benim gözümden kaçan bir aksaklığı birlikte düzelteceğiz. Ve sonunda eksiksiz bir eğitim olarak herkes yararlanabilecek. Umarım iyi bir eğitim dönemi olur ve memnun kalırsın. Bir başka eğitimde görüşmeyi çok isterim. Şimdilik hoşçakal!


Emrah Hoca İle Muhasebe eğitimleri muhasebe alanında gerçeğe en yakın eğitimlerdir. Hayali  işlemlerden uzak, gereksiz yere zihnimizi dolduran sözel eğitimlerden ise tamamen ayrıdır. Eğitimlerde ki temel mantalite öncelikle günlük bir dil kullanmak ve hangi seviyeden olursa olsun herkesin kolayca anlamasını sağlamaktır. Bu nedenle her eğitim önemli bilgiler içerir ve son derece yararlı bilgilerden oluşur.
target_audience: Logo Tiger 2 eğitimi almak isteyen herkes bu eğitimden yararlanabilir.

courses.bio: Prepare and File Your Very Own Chapter 7 Bankruptcy
objectives: How to fill out Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Forms
Where to file your Bankruptcy Forms and How to Locate the necessary Forms
Where to get the Required Pre and Post Credit Counseling
How to Complete and File a Chapter 7 Bankruptcy without an attorney

7 Steps to Filing Chapter 7 Bankruptcy: Step #2 Mandatory Credit Counseling (Pre and Post- Counseling)
Step #3 Filling Out Chapter 7 Bankruptcy forms

requirements: No
courses.description:
This course will provide you with knowledge, skills, and confidence to file your very own Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Petition.  You will gain a clear and concise understanding of how bankruptcies are handled, and the different types of bankruptcies.
You will learn step-by-step instructions on how to fill out a Chapter 7 Bankruptcy Petition, and how to have your filing fees, and the mandatory credit counseling fees, waived.  As a bonus, you will receive the contact information to banks and to mortgage lenders willing to work with individuals after filing Chapter 7 Bankruptcy.  The list includes mortgage lenders, auto lenders and credit card companies. And as an extra bonus, I'll show you how to write off your student loans in a Chapter 7 Bankruptcy!
target_audience: Anyone who wants to learn how to file a Chapter 7 Bankruptcy
Anyone who would like to learn about the Bankruptcy process
Anyone looking to start a Bankruptcy Preparation Business

courses.title: Master Construction Accounting and Reporting
courses.bio: Learn job costing, retainage, and WIP reports to keep your construction projects on budget and profitable.
objectives: Understand how construction accounting differs from regular accounting
Learn how to track construction project financials
Understand the unique characteristics of the construction industry
Manage critical construction reports

Construction Reports: How to Read a WIP Report

requirements: Basic accounting knowledge
courses.description:
The construction industry is a two trillion industry and one of the largest industries in the United States. And bookkeepers and accountants who are familiar with construction accounting are always in high demand.
Construction accounting isn’t like regular accounting—and if you’re a contractor, bookkeeper, or project manager, you need to know the difference. This course breaks down the essential tools and reports that drive financial success in construction projects.
You’ll learn how to handle key construction-specific concepts like retainage, change orders, and progress billing. We’ll explore job costing, job profitability, and WIP (Work-in-Progress) reports, showing you how they all tie together to track project performance in real time.
You’ll also gain a solid understanding of the Work Breakdown Structure (WBS) and cost codes, so you can organize and report on project costs clearly and accurately.
This course includes several Excel-based practice exercises designed to help you apply what you’ve learned. Whether you're managing one job or fifty, you'll walk away with practical skills that can be used immediately in the field or the office.
No prior experience in construction accounting is required—just a basic understanding of financial principles and a willingness to learn. If you've ever struggled to explain variances, justify change orders, or keep up with billing schedules, this course will give you the confidence and clarity to stay ahead of the curve.
target_audience: Accountants and bookkeepers who want to apply their knowledge in the construction industry.

courses.title: Lending Fundamentals and Consumer Credit Assessment
courses.bio: A comprehensive guide to the principles of Consumer Credit Assessment and Lending Fundamentals
objectives: All students will gain a solid understanding of what banks and lending institutions consider when assessing a application for consumer, or personal, credit
All students will gain an appreciation for what information a bank inputs into a Decision Tool for credit assessment
Students will learn the fundamentals of consumer credit assessment and when to apply them. Specifically, the 3Cs, or 3Ss (Capacity, Character, Collateral & Stability, Serviceability, Security)
The course will provide specific tools to help the student become more adept at assessing applications for credit prudently
Students can take a short quiz at the completion of the tutorial to test their learnings
requirements: A very basic understanding of finance. No other tools are required
courses.description:
This course provides in-depth information on the principles of lending to individuals and the universal aspects of prudent credit assessment.
Whether you are in the United States, Europe, Asia or Australia the basic structure of sound lending practice is constant and can be compressed into the 3Cs or 3Ss...Character, Capacity and Collateral, or Stability, Serviceability and Security.
These comprehensive tutorials will guide you through the key elements of each "C", or "S", and provide insight into what a credit assessment or bank officer can do to finely tune their loan decisioning skills.
As the regulatory landscape tightens and there is greater focus on banks and financiers to be more responsible lenders, this course will put you ahead of the curve and provide crucial information and what you can do to make prudent credit decisions.
This course is suitable for anyone interested in credit risk, whether they want to bolster their careers or simply have an interest in how banks review their own application for credit.
The tutorial is complete with a short quiz to test the students knowledge of what they have learned during the course.
target_audience: Bank Officers
Those interested in consumer lending for banks and financial institutions
Credit Assessment Officers
General Public interested in how banks and finance companies assess personal, or consumer, credit applications

Create a Personal Financial Statement to guide your financial decisions so you have a blueprint and get the greatest return for your effort.
Identify keys to staying out of debt forever.
How to get back on secure financial ground and rebuild your financial life.
Know when you should pay off debt or invest money.
Avoid hidden pitfalls that keep you from achieving financial freedom.

Introduction: What You'll Learn in This Course
Assessing Your Finances: Getting the Big Picture of Your Finances
Reduce Your Short-Term Debt: Getting Rid of Credit Card Debt
Pros and Cons of Consolidating Debts
Reduce Your Long-Term Debt: Using the Home Affordable Refinance Program (HARP)

The insurance Industry: Protecting Lives and Assets:
Insurance is a fundamental component of the financial services sector, providing individuals and businesses with protection against various risks. Insurance companies offer policies that cover contingencies such as health issues, accidents, natural disasters, and property damage. These policies provide individuals with peace of mind and businesses with financial security in times of crisis.
The banking and insurance industry plays a vital role in enabling economic growth, managing risks, and safeguarding financial well-being. While facing ongoing challenges, such as technological advancements and regulatory compliance, the industry is also embracing disruptive trends that will shape its future. By leveraging technology, adopting sustainable practices, and prioritizing customer-centric solutions, the banking and insurance industry can continue to thrive and meet the evolving needs of the global community.

requirements: There are no special requirements for this course, anyone can learn about GHG Accounting
courses.description:
Greenhouse gas emissions or, as it is also called, carbon footprint is a fundamental component of the overall sustainability performance of any organisation. Measuring Greenhouse Gas emissions (GHGs) involves quantifying the amount of GHGs released into atmosphere as a result of operations directly or indirectly owned or controlled by a company.  As carbon accounting is becoming mandatory across many regions, we created a course that will help you navigate this subject.
The course provides a brief overview of the key voluntary and mandatory disclosure regulations that require reporting of the greenhouse gases. It defines carbon accounting concepts, explains which data and calculation methods are required in order to  calculate the GHG emissions.
In this course you will explore examples of GHG inventories and sustainability reports so that you feel comfortable understanding and analysing GHG emissions data in these reports. We will discuss key carbon accounting standards, mostly focusing on the Greenhouse Gas Protocol methodology. At the same time we will look at the criticisms of this standard and the solutions that are proposed by the academics from Harvard and Oxford, specifically focussing on E-Liability accounting method and how it drives GHG reductions across value chains and helps with competitiveness and product differentiation based on carbon intensity.
The course is structured in a way that is gives you an insight into the process disregarding the size of the business or the industry, but if you want to dig deeper, we will provide you with additional reading materials by sector. We will briefly touch the question of how technologies and software can help you with the carbon accounting process automation and what you need to pay attention to when choosing the software. And we will also talk about existing collaboration initiatives that you might want to join to get support/benchmarking for your carbon reporting and GHG reduction activities.


This course is part of the "CLIMATE CHANGE FOR PROFESSIONALS" series which consist of the following courses:


1.  Generative AI Practical Guide for Business and Sustainability
2. Carbon Accounting and e-Liability as Tools for GHGs reduction
3. Business Case for Corporate Sustainability: Ultimate Guide
4. Guide to Green Taxonomies and EU Taxonomy Tutorial
5. Key Climate Agreements & Role of Governments/Policymakers
6.  Every Company’s Guide to Climate Action & Achieving Net Zero
7.  Corporate Climate Reporting: Key Standards and Guidelines
8.  ESG in Executive Leaders' Agenda: Reporting and Analytics
9.  Power Sector Decarbonisation and Energy Transition
10.  Heavy Industry Decarbonisation and Energy Transition
11.  Transport and Mobility Decarbonisation & Energy Transition
12.  Blockchain Technology in Climate Change and Sustainability


You can find the links to all courses on my Udemy profile page - just click my name at the bottom of the course description just before the course reviews.


*** Always check my website (Shortlisted Productions) for the latest discounts on the courses and follow me on social media (LinkedIn) ***


Thank you for choosing my courses!
Sincerely yours,
Julia Mariasova

courses.title: Mystery Shopper 101
courses.bio: How to Start, Grow, and Succeed in Mystery Shopping
objectives: Mystery Shopper 101
requirements: None
courses.description:
● Mystery shopping is a unique industry that allows management to get an inside look at various aspects of their businesses
● Mystery shops can evaluate customer service, store appearance, availability and placement of promotional signage, and so much more!
● Traditional mystery shops are covert and in-person, but non-traditional shops, such as revealed and remote shops, are becoming more popular
● Video and mobile shops are competing for the fastest growing segment of the mystery shopping industry
● Mystery shopping is extremely flexible, allowing you to only apply for shops that fit into your schedule
● Confidentiality and maintaining anonymity are pillars of mystery shopping
● Shop aggregators like Jobslinger and MS Job Board make searching for available shops in your location so easy!
● Other great ways to find available shops are through mystery shopping forums and social media
● There are literally hundreds of mystery shopping companies out there, so registering with all of them can be a bit tedious, but this book gives some tips that will make the process less cumbersome
● Submitting great reports is essential for a successful mystery shopper, and this book shows you exactly how to do so!
● Mystery shoppers own their own businesses, so researching laws in your city, county, and state about starting a business is crucial
● Business taxes for mystery shopping can be complicated, but this book offers some basic advice on what is required and how to track income and expenses
About the Expert
Mystery shopping since the early 2000’s, Penny Hodgin has seen and adapted to many changes in the mystery shopping industry. What began as a teenager’s side hustle to earn some extra cash and free meals has evolved into a passion for helping businesses treat their customers and employees with the respect they deserve by providing honest observations and factual reports. Brooks has shopped professionally in various industries including retail, financial, entertainment, real estate, food service, and more...and has truly enjoyed the experience gained from each and every shop!
target_audience: People Interested to work as Mystery Shopper

courses.title: Introduction to Sustainable Investing
courses.bio: Climate Change, Sustainable Investing, ESG
objectives: Climate Change
Decarbonising the World: Forecasting the Century
Regulations and Corporate Reporting
Mitigation by Sector
Investments
Portfolios

Introduction to Sustainable Investing: Decarbonising the world: Forecasting the century

requirements: Whatever your background, in little more than an hour this introductory course will give you fascinating insights into climate change, security analysis and sustainable investing.
courses.description:
Are you a keen investor and want to make greener choices?
Or are you an enthusiastic environmentalist and want to apply your passion to finance?
This short introduction to sustainable investing will help to bring these two sides together. Yes – you can invest successfully and still help to save the planet.
The course contains six topics:
Climate Change – what it is, why it happens, outline of the impacts and risks that affect all of us.
Decarbonising the World: Forecasting the Century – if we’re going to save the planet we need to have a plan telling us what must change over the coming decades.
Regulations and Corporate Reporting – what companies report, or should report, to help understand their impact, and an outline of existing and upcoming regulations.
Mitigation by Sector – a review of the energy sector, both fossil fuel and renewable-based generation, and the highest emitting sectors.
Investments – how to incorporate climate factors when analysing shares, bonds and private assets such as real estate and infrastructure.
Portfolios – the big picture, how portfolios can be built and managed with climate in mind.
The programme will explain much of the terminology that you will hear, debunk some of the propaganda and hopefully help you to distinguish between companies that are genuinely becoming green from those that are greenwashing.
target_audience: This is intended for anyone interested in sustainable investing, green finance, climate change or the impact of climate on portfolios. Beginners welcome!

Article d'approfondissement: Vers un cadre macroéconomique de la finance islamique

requirements: Pas de prérequis nécessaires pour le cours
courses.description:
Ce cours permettra de comprendre en quelques heures les principes essentiels de la finance islamique. Il ne fera pas de vous un expert mais vous donnera la grille de lecture pour désormais comprendre facilement ce dont parlent les experts. Il est un fondamental essentiel de la discipline et vous permettra d'aller de l'avant dans ce domaine, que ce soit par simple curiosité pour par ambition de vous professionnaliser.
Dans un premier temps nous aborderons les principes jurisprudentiels fondateurs de la discipline. L'idée est de simplement vous permettre de voir le processus de construction de la fatwa, l'avis juridique donc, en Islam, de manière générale. Ensuite, en entonnoir, nous irons au particulier, vers la jurisprudence des transactions pour la détailler rapidement.
Dans le second module nous verrons les principaux interdits et la sagesse de ces principales interdictions en finance islamique. Nous ferons un focus rapide en étude de cas sur le Maroc ainsi que son conseil supérieur des oulemas, en tant qu'autorité shariatique suprême.
Ce cours insistera sur les aspects fondamentaux et donnera une vision globale. Ce cours est essentiel pour ceux qui souhaitent travailler dans la finance islamique, un secteur en croissance constante à l'échelle mondiale, et qui nécessite une compréhension approfondie des transactions et des principes financiers islamiques pour prospérer dans ce domaine.
target_audience: Débutants en finance islamique
Professionnels de finance désirant se réorienter

Bu eğitim, Netsis'in ön muhasebe sistemini kullanmayı kapsamlı bir şekilde öğretmek için tasarlanmıştır. Eğitim, Netsis'in temel paketi baz alınarak hazırlanmış olup, bütün modüllerde detaylara değinilmektedir. Eğitimin odak noktalarından biri de e-fatura, e-arşiv ve e-irsaliye gibi elektronik belge işlemlerinin kullanımı üzerinedir. Bu belgelerin kullanımında sık karşılaşılan yanlışlar ele alınarak, doğru kullanım teknikleri örneklerle anlatılmaktadır.
Uygulamalarla Netsis Ön Muhasebe Eğitim içeriği, cari hesaplar, stok kartları,parametreler,şube açılışı, müşteri çekleri, müşteri senetleri, borç çekleri, borç senetleri, dekont, kasa, banka işlemleri, e-fatura işlemleri, e-arşiv işlemleri, e-irsaliye işlemleri, alış irsaliyeleri toplu faturalandırma, satış irsaliyelerini toplu faturalandırma, satış faturası ve alış faturaları gibi modüllerde yer alan tüm konuları detaylı bir şekilde kapsamaktadır. Ayrıca serbest raporlar , eklentiler ve zamanlanmış görevler gibi özellikler de detaylı olarak işlenmektedir. Modüllerin pratik kullanımı, ilgili raporlar ve iş süreçlerinde dikkat edilmesi gereken püf noktaları üzerinde durulmaktadır.
Netsis'i yeni öğrenmeye başlayacak olanlar için ideal bir başlangıç noktası olan bu temel eğitim, aynı zamanda mevcut kullanıcıların bilgilerini tazelemeleri veya ileri seviye kullanım tekniklerini öğrenmeleri için de uygundur. Eğer bir firmada Netsis kullanıcısı olarak çalışıyorsanız, kendinizi bu alanda geliştirmek istiyorsanız veya Netsis kullanımı gerektiren iş pozisyonları için başvuruda bulunacaksanız, bu eğitim işlerinizi profesyonel bir düzeyde yürütebilmeniz için size temelde yeterli bilgi ve beceri sağlayacaktır.

courses.description:
Negotiation Applied: Practical at Work Negotiating
Negotiate effectively at work - practical salary negotiation, buying, selling, procurement, pay rise, etc


Knowing how to negotiate effectively, and with confidence, is a skill that can make a huge difference to your career, your day-to-day work life and your personal wellbeing. Whether it’s negotiating the starting salary for a new job, getting that pay rise you know you deserve, agreeing on deals and contracts with suppliers and customers, or dealing with a difficult colleague - knowing how to negotiate properly is essential in every single area of work.


The negotiation skills you will develop during this course will allow you to head into intense discussions without stress or worry. You’ll become a master of the art of negotiation and learn practical insights that can be applied throughout your life (including outside of work!), whether that’s buying a new home or selling a car.


Of course, money is often the focus of many negotiations, and small wins can make a huge difference to your organization's performance and how seriously you are taken in the workplace. Maybe you need to be stronger in contract negotiations, or tow a harder line in procurement? Perhaps you’re getting passed over for promotions, or you feel like new and exciting opportunities are passing you by. Poor negotiation is a weakness that can be taken advantage of, but this course you will turn your negotiation skills into a superpower.


By the time you finish this course, you will have developed fundamental skills that are essential to successful negotiation. You’ll know how to enter negotiations from a position of strength, and how to navigate your way to an effective result. First, we’ll cover the basics of negotiating, then we’ll apply these principles to real-life examples using a step by step process that you can use in any situation. These practical skills will spill over into all aspects of your life, allowing you to know your worth and how to leverage negotiations for a win-win outcome.


Chris Croft is an international speaker, and widely published author, who's been teaching Negotiation to companies for over 20 years. He's taught all over the world, as well as online, and has an entertaining and practical teaching style. This course is guaranteed to keep you engaged and amused, and teach you life-changing skills for home and work.


The course overview includes:
Applying negotiation theory to 7 real-life work scenarios
Planning your negotiation toolkit
Setting your Walk Away Point
How to make a suitable Opening Offer
Tradeables - what they are and why they're vital
Getting a pay rise, or negotiating your hiring salary
How to negotiate when either buying or selling at work
Creating a non-confrontational conversation between a difficult colleague or boss
Common techniques that will be used against you - and how to combat them
How to rid yourself of excuses and worries around negotiating
Simple negotiation phrases that will get you a brilliant price
And lots, lots more!
target_audience: People wanting to improve their confidence in negotiating, or hone existing skills
Those who work in procurement, buying or selling
Someone who wants to get a pay rise, and negotiate effectively in job interviews
People who have a difficult colleague or boss
Anyone wanting to be richer in their personal and professional life
People who would like to have more successful and interesting projects at work
Both beginners and experts - this course has lots of little known techniques included

courses.title: 【現場で活きる！】「数字に強い人になる」決算書と業績数字の見方・考え方
courses.bio: 数字に強くなれると上司やお客様へ自信をもって提案できるようになります。最低限の会計知識をおさえた上で会社の数字の勘所について学びましょう。「数字に強いビジネスパーソン」になるための具体的な方法論を学んでステップアップしましょう！
objectives: 上司やお客様に対して数字をベースにした説得力のある提案ができるようになります
自分が把握すべき会社の業績数字が分かるようになります
会社の業績と自分の仕事とのつながりが理解できるようになります
数字をベースにした部署のマネジメントができるようになります
非経理職として最低限必要な会計知識が身につきます

イントロダクション: はじめに～講座の全体像
必ずおさえておこう！会計の基本のキ: まずは市場経済の仕組みを学ぼう
会計についてアウトラインを理解する
貸借対照表（B/S）と損益計算書（P/L）とは
損益計算書（P/L）についてもっと詳しく
貸借対照表（B/S）についてもっと詳しく
損益計算書と貸借対照表のつながり
会計の基本知識おさらい
決算書の見方が分かれば次は比較してみよう: 決算書は何かと比較してはじめて意味がある
どのように比較・分析すればよいか
損益計算書を予算と比較・分析する
（ワーク）損益計算書の予算比較分析
（ワーク解答）損益計算書の予算比較分析
損益計算書を過年度と比較・分析する
損益計算書を競合他社・業界平均と比較する
「数字に強い人」と言われるために: そもそも「数字に強い人」とは？
重要な数字は局面ごとに変化する
まず自分にとって重要な数字は何かを確認する
重要な数字のつかみ方
数字の裏側にあるストーリーを考えよう
数字を要素分解してみよう
数字の要素分解活用例①：販売予算の妥当性を検証する
数字の要素分解活用例②：店舗の改善施策の経済効果
自分の仕事にどう活かすか: 仕事にもどってから取り組むべきこと

requirements: 会計財務の知識はいりません。初心者でも学べます
courses.description:
【こういうことに悩んでいませんか？】
・管理職になって業績責任を問われるようになったが、何をどうすればいいかわからない
・「売上目標達成だけじゃなく利益に貢献するように」と上司から言われてしまった
・上司にプレゼンしたものの、「客観的な根拠を示せていない」と却下された
・お客様に提案したものの「その提案内容では上を説得できない」と言われてしまった
・会計・財務を勉強したが使いどころが分からない
・会社の業績報告を聞いてもさっぱり理解できない

これらに該当する方がおられたらぜひ受講をご検討ください。

このコースはいわゆる「決算書の作成・読解講座」ではありません。
会計を専門としないビジネスパーソンが、会社の業績数字に強くなるための方法を学ぶ講座です。

「決算書・財務諸表」についてのセミナーは巷に溢れていますし、受講された方も多いのではないでしょうか。
私も何度も受講したことがあります。
確かに面白いですし勉強にもなります。
知的興奮を覚えセミナーの帰り道に本屋によって何冊も会計についての本を購入する、といったことも一度や二度ではありません。
ただ、日数が経ち知的興奮が収まるにつれセミナーで得た知識も薄れていき、買った本も「積ん読」状態へ…。

身に覚えはないでしょうか？

こういう現象は、セミナー内容と私たちが得るべき知識・スキルとが乖離しているときに起こります。
「必要に迫られていない状態で勉強した知識は忘れてしまう」のです。

会計や財務を専門としない方が数字に強くなるために得るべき知識は有名大企業の財務諸表の中ではなく、自らが所属している会社の中にあると私は考えています。
さらに会計のテクニカルな論点よりも、「売上」「粗利」「営業利益」「販管費」「在庫」等の基礎的なデータの積み上げの中にヒントが眠っていることが多いのです。

また、部門や職責によって押さえておくべき数字は異なります。
営業職の新入社員が、ROE（株主資本利益率）を覚えておく必要がどれだけあるでしょうか？
それよりも自部門や取扱製品の売上・粗利について徹底的に深堀りし頭に入れていたほうがより「デキる社員」に近づくはずです。

会社の数字の使い方をマスターし、「数字に強い、デキるビジネスパーソン」になるためのファーストステップを一緒に踏み出しませんか？

＜講座の内容＞

1.必ずおさえておこう！会計の基本のキ
・市場経済のしくみ
・会計とはそもそも何か？
・損益計算書（P/L）と貸借対照表（B/S）とは
・損益計算書をもっと詳しく
・貸借対照表をもっと詳しく
・損益計算書と貸借対照表はつながっている
・会計の基本知識おさらい

2.決算書の見方が分かれば次は比較してみよう
・決算書は何かと比較して初めて意味がある
・予算と比較してみる
・過去と比較してみる
・同業他社や業界平均と比較してみる

3.数字に強い人と言われるために
・重要な数字は置かれた立場によって変わる
・重要な数字をつかむことの重要性
・数字の裏側にあるストーリーを考えよう
・数字を要素分解する
・数字の要素分解活用例①：販売予算の妥当性を検証する
・数字の要素分解活用例②：店舗の改善施策の経済効果

4.自分の仕事でどう活かすか
・仕事にもどってから取り組むべきこと


※1章で最低限必要な会計基礎知識を学びます。それを踏まえたうえで
2-3章で会社数字の取り回し方を中心に学んでいきます。


【学んだあとはこうなります】
・上司やお客様に対して数字をベースにした説得力のある提案ができるようになります
・自分が把握すべき会社の業績数字が分かるようになります
・会社の業績と自分の仕事とのつながりが理解できるようになります
・数字をベースにした部署のマネジメントができるようになります
・非経理職として最低限必要な会計知識が身につきます
target_audience: 「数字に強い」と言われたいビジネスパーソン
部門業績に責任をもつ管理職
会社の業績数字を理解したい社会人の方

courses.title: Risk, Payments and Fraud
courses.bio: How to detect and prevent fraud in your online business
objectives: Detect and prevent fraud in your online business
Identify red flags and how they appear at many different points in the customer journey

Learn how payments are being processed behind the scenes
Recognize the risks associated with the theft or compromise of personal data
Credit Card Transaction Processing
The risks associated with the theft or compromise of credit card data
How to prevent fraud and reduce chargebacks
Profiling cybercriminals and identifying their motives
requirements: No previous experience or knowledge required
courses.description:
Learn how to detect and prevent fraudulent abuse of your ecommerce business by getting trained in the fraud red flags and how they appear at many different points in a customer’s journey.
Have you ever wondered how payments are being processed behind the scenes? And when a card is stolen, what usually happens to the compromised data? In this course, we are going to answer these questions and more, explaining how payments get from merchants to banks, as well as the risks associated with the theft or compromise of personal data—both to customers and merchants. We will highlight the various entities involved in payment processing and how they protect against card data loss. We will also cover the difference between fraud and money laundering and which red flags are an indication for each one.
We're also going to talk about the most common scam techniques used by fraudsters to try and obtain your personal data, like the West African Fraud, Miracle Health Scams, Online Shopping Fraud, Romance Scams, Phishing and many others.
This is an all-encompassing course that provides a broad overview of the payments processing industry including its main features, issues and trends.
You will be given a lot of examples of fraud in multiple industries, including e-commerce, iGaming, casinos, retailers and more.
You don’t need to have any previous knowledge or experience in payments to understand and follow this course, you just need to be curious about how payments work and how fraud can be prevented.
target_audience: People who want to start a career in Risk, Payments and Fraud
Online businesses and e-commerce operators wishing to train their entry level employees
Analysts, data scientists and engineers working in Risk, Payments and Fraud
Anyone who is passionate about mitigating risk and catching fraudsters
Beginners in the Payments Industry

courses.description:
Whoever tells you the government is cutting back... THEY'RE WRONG.
In 2015 the U.S. Government will give out an average of $22,996 in free money to each family. That's an increase from $21,816 in 2014, In 2016 It is going to increase again to $24,159. Do this sound like a cut back?????
The government has over 17,000 programs that hand out free money and fee services to people of all incomes and all ages. Here are some facts about these programs that the average person does not know about:
- Uncle Sam hands out over $1.7 TRILLION PER YEAR per year and spends next to NOTHING ON ADVERTISING to let people know these programs.
- Only 20% of this money is set aside for low income people. For most programs it does not matter what your income is, they are for people who want to do things or solve problems.

- Low income programs cover people making up to $44,000 per year.
- 80% of the free money available is NOT CALLED "GRANTS".
- Most of the free money programs only require a 2-3 page of "fill in the blanks" application.
- The government represents over 35% of our economy and has programs that can help every member of our society no matter what your age, income, or education level.

I had a very successful business helping rich people make even more money by taking advantage of these programs. Now I devote my life to help the average person know about the free money and help that is available to them too.
After 35 years of studying these programs I've developed a course for those who want to begin learning the system of applying to the 25 BEST FREE MONEY PROGRAMS that America has to offer.
These TOP 25 programs can help the most people of all incomes. These are programs you should know about if you need:
Money And Help For A Business

Money And Help To Buy Or Fix Up A Home
Money And Help For Health Care Issues

EVERY STUDENT HAS PERSONAL ACCESS TO THE INSTRUCTOR AND HIS RESEARCHERS

Whether you're a seasoned banker, financial analyst, or just on the peripheries of being new into the world of corporate credit, this course is your ticket to success and mastery in this niche world.


Why This Course?
Comprehensive Learning: This four-module course will help you understand credit principles in the contracting industry, nuances in legal business structures, and advanced financial analysis. Each module has been designed to build expertise step by step.
Industry-Specific Insights: Understand the specific nature of contracting—the roles of players involved, what makes this industry ticks, important financial instruments such as bank guarantees, the bidding process and the hidden secrets to award a contract, and the particular accounting to be adopted for project execution.
Legal and Financial Mastery: The legal forms of company formation and understanding their relationship to credit decisions.
Financial Analysis: Learn how to effectively read financial statements, cash flows, and ratio analysis when making decisions on appropriate risk-sensitive lending.
Hands-on real-world case studies, examples, and professional practical tools that you'll be able to apply instantly in your day-to-day work.
Expert Guidance: Learn from the expert in the field as a highly experienced practitioner with over 42 years of experience,  distills many years of own insight into a course that is comprehensive and easy to follow.
You learn theory but, more importantly, how to apply it in real-life scenarios.


Who Should Register?
Bankers and financial analysts seeking to specialize in corporate credit of contracting companies.
Professionals in the contracting industry looking to gain a deeper understanding of finance and credit.
Goal-oriented entrepreneurs and business owners within the contracting space who want to learn how to effectively manage finances and credit relationships.
Student and academics seeking competitive advantage in the domain of corporate finance.


Course Modules:
Principles of Credit: Build a foundation to understand what underpins sound credit decision-making and how this informs more advanced topics.
The Contracting Industry: Discover what makes this industry special, learn the important players, and the useful financial tools and bank guarantees that help maintain projects on course.
Company Formation Legal Forms: Learn the types of business structures for their impact on credit and finance from sole proprietorships up to joint ventures.
Principles of Accounting and Financial Analysis: Get the art of analysis of income statements, balance sheets, and cash flows right, and it should all come together and reveal the whole power of analysis through ratios.


Why Choose this Course?
An Uncommon Opportunity: Rarely will you find contracting applied with the specifics of corporate credit. A great resource for advancing your career.
Skills to Boost Your Career: Equip yourself with the knowledge and tools to shine in your field, make wise lending decisions, and contribute more effectively to your organization's success.
Lifetime Access: You can learn at your own pace and have lifetime access to course materials.
Take the Leap Today!
Invest in your future and gain the skills that will set you apart. Enroll now in "The Ultimate Contracting Corporate Credit and Finance" and start your journey toward becoming an expert in this vital field.
target_audience: Credit Analysts, Bank Managers, Financial Analysts, Credit Officers in Banks.
Investors in Properties, Bankers involved in Syndicated Loans.
Entrepreneurs, Contractors, Managers involved in Credit Rating, Financial Decision Makers
Junior Employees aspiring for banking positions, People seeking Position in Financial Management and Decision Making, Economists,

courses.title: Corporate Finance #5 Financing Decisions
courses.bio: Unlock Growth Potential: Mastering Company Financing Decisions for Strategic Corporate Finance
objectives: Define company financing decisions and their significance in corporate finance.
Analyze different financing patterns and strategies used by corporations to optimize growth and manage risk.
Evaluate short-term and long-term financing options based on company's future sales and production projections.
Assess the pros and cons of seasonal production versus level production in relation to financing needs.
Examine equipment financing options and differentiate between short-term and long-term financing strategies.
Analyze the financing considerations for permanent and temporary assets and develop appropriate financing strategies.
Apply financial analysis techniques to estimate financing needs and determine optimal financing solutions.
Utilize Excel worksheets to solve complex financing problems and create financial models for decision-making.
Evaluate the impact of financing decisions on company growth and profitability.
Synthesize key concepts and strategies to make informed company financing decisions aligned with strategic corporate finance goals.

Practice Probs - Financing Decisions: 611 Estimated Sales Values Estimated Sales Values
613 Estimating Financing Needed for Increase in Assets
617 Short Term Loan vs Long Term Loan
619 Equipment Short Term Financing vs Long Term Loan Financing
626 Expectations Hypothesis Theory for Expected Returns on Securities
629 Break Even Point in Interest Rates
Excel Probs - Financing Decisions: 613 Estimating Financing Needed for Increase in Assets
617 Short Term Loan vs Long Term Loan
619 Equipment Short Term Financing vs Long Term Loan Financing
626 Expectations Hypothesis Theory for Expected Return on Securities
629 Break Even Point in Interest Rates

requirements: Basic understanding of corporate finance principles and concepts, including financial statements, financial analysis, and financial decision-making.
Access to a computer or laptop with internet connectivity to access course materials, practice exercises, and Excel worksheets.
Eagerness to learn and apply strategic corporate finance concepts to make informed company financing decisions.
Openness to hands-on practice and willingness to work with Microsoft Excel or similar software to solve practice problems and create financial models.
courses.description:
In this comprehensive course, we will explore company financing decisions from a corporate finance perspective, equipping you with the knowledge and strategies to drive company growth while effectively managing risk.
Financing plays a vital role in the growth and success of companies. By understanding the optimal financing strategies, businesses can accelerate their growth trajectory while mitigating potential risks. Throughout the course, we will examine the general financing patterns of corporations, delve into short-term and long-term financing options, and discuss how companies estimate future sales and production levels to determine their financing needs.
We will explore different production approaches, including seasonal production and level production, and analyze their implications for financing requirements. Furthermore, we will delve into the financing considerations for equipment, both in terms of short-term and long-term financing, and explore financing strategies for permanent and temporary assets.
To enhance your learning experience, the course offers numerous example problems, presented in both a presentation format and through Excel worksheets. Each Excel worksheet problem is accompanied by a downloadable Excel worksheet, featuring at least two tabs—one with the answer key and another with a preformatted worksheet for you to complete step-by-step, along with instructional videos that guide you through the process.
Join us on this dynamic journey to master company financing decisions and unleash the potential for growth and profitability. Enroll today to gain the skills to optimize financing options, strategically manage company growth, and make informed financial decisions in a competitive business landscape. By the end of the course, you will have the tools and knowledge to drive company success through effective corporate finance strategies.
target_audience: Finance professionals, including financial analysts, managers, and executives, who want to enhance their expertise in company financing decisions and strategic corporate finance.
Business owners and entrepreneurs seeking to optimize their company's growth potential through effective financing strategies and decision-making.

Managers and decision-makers involved in financial management, budgeting, and strategic planning, looking to strengthen their understanding of company financing and its impact on business performance.
Students pursuing degrees or certifications in finance, accounting, or related fields, who want to develop a strong foundation in company financing decisions and strategic corporate finance.
Professionals involved in investment analysis, mergers and acquisitions, or financial consulting, who want to deepen their understanding of the financial aspects of company financing.
Individuals interested in advancing their knowledge of corporate finance and financial decision-making in a business context.
Anyone with a curiosity and enthusiasm for understanding the intricacies of company financing and its role in driving business growth and profitability.

courses.title: ¡ADIÓS POBREZA, HOLA DINERO!
courses.bio: La Transformación De Tu Interior Para El Camino Hacia La Riqueza
objectives: Liberarte de tus creencias respecto al dinero
Re-programar tu mente

Incrementar tu dinero
Tener hábitos positivos del dinero
Liberarte sobre tus peores miedos
Conocer tu situación financiera desde tu interior
El dinero desde otra perspectiva
Cómo afecta tu energía a tu dinero
Transformar tu mente y creencias sobre el dinero

Tema 1. ¿Cómo afecta tu energía al diner: El dinero desde una perspectiva diferente
Tema 2. Las creencias que me compré: La importancia del dinero-Mis pensamientos relacionados con el dinero
Las fuentes de obtención del dinero
¿Por qué no llega dinero a mi vida a pesar de mi trabajo?
Tema 3. La Clave del Éxito: Cambiando mi energía, cambiando mis pensamientos
¿Cómo comenzar a recibir y a merecer?
Tema 4. ¿Cómo cambio mis patrones de con: Mi fidelidad, ¿A quién le soy fiel?
Tema 5. El Miedo y mi Generación de Camb: Cambio de creencias; ¿Cuáles son mis miedos?

requirements: Mentalidad abierta
courses.description:
¿Te has preguntado por qué a pesar de que intentas hacer un cambio en tus finanzas personales no lo logras?
Te pasa de todo; estás preocupado, el dinero no rinde, tus deudas siguen ahí y continúan incrementando, a veces ya no sabes cómo puedes hacer para tener el dinero suficiente y pagar los gastos, y simplemente no puedes salir de ese ciclo en el que continúas dando una y otra vuelta, sin que este ciclo tenga un fin.
Este curso que he creado, está diseñado para ayudarte a saber porqué es que no puedes avanzar y tener más dinero, porqué te cuesta tanto hacer un cambio en tus hábitos financieros o tomar acción para cumplir tus objetivos o sueños y porqué simplemente no tienes todo el dinero que tú deseas tener. También te diré qué puedes hacer para liberarte de todo lo que no te permite avanzar, cambiar tu mentalidad, tus creencias, transformar tus hábitos y te mostraré el dinero desde una perspectiva diferente.
¡Te veo en el curso,
un fuerte abrazo!


"Considero que ninguna persona debería ser pobre, creo que la forma en la que nos educan, determina completamente la forma en la que vivimos, si las personas no tienen dinero y están dispuestos a tenerlo, entonces el dinero llegará. El cambio comienza desde adentro, nunca será desde el exterior, ese es el grave error. La vida sería más fácil si nos atreviéramos al cambio y nos liberáramos de cualquier limitación; si quieres algo, ve por ello" -Catherine Bravo.
target_audience: Personas que quieran cambiar su situación financiera
Personas que tengan curiosidad en conocer otra perspectiva del dinero
Personas que quieran aprender acerca del dinero
Personas que busquen una transformación interna

courses.title: Management Accounting in 30 Minutes
courses.bio: A Fast-Track Introduction to Financial Decision-Making
objectives: Understand the Fundamentals of Management Accounting
Comprehend Key Management Accounting Concepts
Apply Cost-Volume-Profit (CVP) Analysis
Learn the Importance of Budgeting and Forecasting
Evaluate Performance Using KPIs and Variance Analysis
Make Informed Short-Term Decisions Using Relevant Costs
requirements: No prior experience is required to enroll in this course
courses.description:
"Management Accounting in 30 Minutes" is an essential online course designed for individuals seeking a quick yet comprehensive understanding of management accounting. This course provides a clear and concise overview of the core principles, tools, and techniques used in management accounting, helping participants apply them effectively in real-world business scenarios.
In just 30 minutes, learners will grasp the differences between financial and management accounting, explore cost types and classifications, and understand key concepts like fixed and variable costs, direct and indirect costs, and cost-volume-profit analysis. The course also covers the fundamentals of budgeting and forecasting, showing how these tools support business planning, control, and decision-making.
Additionally, the course dives into performance measurement and variance analysis, introducing essential metrics like Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) to evaluate business performance and identify areas for improvement. It also highlights short-term decision-making, including the role of relevant costs and contribution margin in making strategic choices that drive profitability.
By the end of the course, participants will have a foundation in management accounting, enabling them to make more informed and effective business decisions. The course concludes with key takeaways and encourages further learning, ensuring participants are ready to apply their new knowledge to improve business strategy and operations.
target_audience: Busy professionals who want to gain a quick understanding of management accounting concepts.

courses.title: Mastering IFRS 13: Fair Value Measurement
courses.bio: Unlock the secrets of fair value measurement with practical insights and expert guidance
objectives: Deep Understanding of Fair Value Measurement: Learn what fair value really means, how it is used in practice, and why it is crucial in financial reporting.
Application of Valuation Techniques: Master the three primary valuation techniques: the market approach, the cost approach, and the income approach.
Identification of Appropriate Markets: Understand how to determine the principal and most advantageous markets for fair value calculations.
Insights into Market Participants: Gain insights into who qualifies as market participants and how their perspective shapes fair value.
Practical Application: Apply the concepts of fair value to real-world scenarios, enhancing your ability to handle complex financial reporting tasks.

IFRS 13: Fair Value Measurement: Introduction of IFRS 13- Fair Value Measurement
Markets - Principal or Most Advantageous Market
Determining the Fair Value of Non-Financial Assets
Valuation Techniques for Determining Fair Value
Hierarchical Approach to Fair Value Inputs

requirements: Basic understanding of accounting principles.
Interest in deepening knowledge of International Financial Reporting Standards.
Access to financial statements and market data for practical exercises (recommended, not required).
courses.description:
Embark on an in-depth exploration of IFRS 13: Fair Value Measurement with this detailed and engaging course designed for professionals and students in the field of accounting and finance. As fair value continues to play a pivotal role in financial reporting, understanding its intricacies is crucial for anyone involved in the preparation, analysis, or audit of financial statements. This course unravels the complexities of IFRS 13, providing you with a solid foundation in the principles of fair value measurement and its practical implications.
Through a series of structured lectures, you will learn the definitions, requirements, and applications of fair value in the context of international financial reporting standards. The course covers key topics such as the identification of the principal and most advantageous markets, the roles and perspectives of market participants, and the implementation of various valuation techniques including the market, cost, and income approaches. Each lecture is supplemented with real-world examples and practical exercises designed to reinforce your learning and enable you to apply these concepts in real-life scenarios.
By the end of this course, you will not only grasp the theoretical underpinnings of fair value measurement but also be proficient in its practical application, enhancing your skills in financial analysis and reporting. Whether you're preparing for professional advancement or academic excellence, this course offers the tools and insights needed to excel in the complex landscape of financial standards.
target_audience: Accounting professionals looking to enhance their expertise in financial reporting standards.
Finance students seeking to deepen their understanding of IFRS.
Auditors and financial analysts who require a thorough grasp of valuation techniques.
Any professionals involved in the preparation or analysis of financial statements.

courses.title: Gestion des Risques : Une Approche COSO & ERM
courses.bio: De l'Évaluation à la Limitation des Risques : Stratégies et Pratiques pour une Entreprise Résiliente et Conforme
objectives: Maîtrise les fondamentaux du cadre de contrôle interne du COSO
Maîtrise les fondamentaux du cadre ERM du COSO
Développer ses compétence en évaluation des Risques
Comprendre les stratégies de limitation des risques

Introduction: Présentation du cours et du formateur
Le cadre de contrôle interne: Objectifs du COSO : L'efficience des opérations
Objectifs du COSO : La fiabilité des rapports financiers
Objectifs du COSO : La conformité avec les lois et régulations
Composants du cadre de contrôle interne : L'environnement de contrôle
Composants du cadre de contrôle interne : L'évaluation des risques
Composants du cadre de contrôle interne : Les activités de contrôle
Composants du cadre de contrôle interne : L'information et la communication
Composants du cadre de contrôle interne : Les activités de surveillance
Cas pratique : Exemple de l'enterprise X
Quiz sur le cadre de contrôle interne
Le cadre de gestion des risques (ERM): Cas pratique : Exemple d'une organisation X
L'évaluation et la limitation des risque: Techniques quantitatives : L'analyse de la sensibilité
Techniques quantitatives : La simulation de Monte Carlo
Techniques quantitatives : Les arbres de décision
Questionnaire sur l'évaluation et la limitation des risques

requirements: Aucune prérequis.
courses.description:
Ce cours intensif plonge les participants dans l'écosystème complexe de la gestion des risques, en commençant par une exploration détaillée du COSO, une méthode renommée pour optimiser la gouvernance et la gestion des risques. Vous découvrirez les principes essentiels et les applications pratiques du cadre de contrôle interne, apprenant comment chaque composant s'articule pour renforcer la fiabilité financière, la conformité réglementaire et l'efficacité opérationnelle.
L'aventure d'apprentissage se poursuit avec le cadre ERM, qui élargit le champ de vision pour embrasser une perspective stratégique de la gestion des risques. Vous gagnerez des insights sur la manière d'aligner efficacement la gestion des risques avec les objectifs globaux de l’entreprise, transformant ainsi les défis en opportunités stratégiques.
Une attention particulière est accordée à l'évaluation des risques, où les méthodes quantitatives et qualitatives sont démystifiées. Vous acquerrez des compétences pratiques pour identifier et analyser les risques de manière incisive, préparant le terrain pour des décisions éclairées.
Le final du parcours offre un éclairage sur les stratégies de maîtrise des risques, avec des techniques concrètes et des approches innovantes pour minimiser l'exposition aux risques et renforcer la résilience organisationnelle. Cette formation complète assure que chaque participant ressort doté des outils et de la confiance nécessaires pour naviguer dans le paysage en constante évolution de la gestion des risques.
target_audience: Le contenu du cours est adapté pour offrir une valeur ajoutée tangible à toute personne intéressée à maîtriser les intrications de la gestion des risques dans le contexte organisationnel, en se basant sur des cadres éprouvés pour une entreprise résiliente et performante.

courses.title: Financial Reporting Made Simple
courses.bio: Financial Reporting: Group Account and International Financial Reporting Standards
objectives: Explain the importance of regulatory frameworks for accounting and reporting;
Identify and state the circumstances in which private sector entities are required to prepare and present statutory financial statements;
Identify and state the laws, regulations, accounting standards and other requirements that govern the preparation of financial statements;
Account for specific transactions in accordance with relevant international accounting standards;
Draft and present financial statements, or extract from them, of an entity and simple groups in accordance with its chosen policies and in accordance with IFRS
Assess the circumstances in which the use of IFRS may not be required for companies;

Group Account: GA - Understanding Basic Consolidation & Consolidation Procedures with Goodwill
Group Account - Various Adjustments in Group Accounting and Consolidations
Group Account (Part 1) Investment in Associate and Various Acquisitions in Group
International Financial Reporting Standa: IFRS 5 - Non-Current Assets Held For Sale and Discontinued Operations

requirements: No Prerequisite
courses.description:
Detailed Syllabus A. Conceptual and regulatory frameworks for financial reporting 10% 1. Conceptual Framework (a) Explain the meaning and purpose of conceptual framework. (b) Explain the objectives, qualitative characteristics and limitations of financial statements. (c) Discuss the underlying assumptions in preparing financial statements. (d) Identify users of financial statements and their information needs. (e) Identify and discuss the elements of financial statements. (f) Explain the concept of capital maintenance. (g) Differentiate between principle-based and rule-based financial reporting frameworks. (h) Discuss accrual and cash bases of accounting. (i) Discuss financial statements in relation to reporting entities under the conceptual framework.
2. Regulatory framework (a) Discuss the need for a regulatory framework in financial reporting. (b) Identify and discuss laws, regulations, accounting standards and other requirements that govern the preparation of financial statements. (c) Identify and discuss relevant provisions of Companies and Allied Matters Act 2020, and special pronouncements by regulatory authorities (CBN, NDIC, FRCN, NAICOM, NSE, SEC, PENCOM, etc.). (d) Explain the standard setting process of International Accounting Standards Board (IASB) and the relationship with national standard setters. (e) Discuss the process for revision of standards. (f) Discuss the process of adoption of IFRSs and application of local standards. (g) Explain the peculiar nature and relevant frameworks of specialized, not-for-profit and public sector entities including IFRS, national standards and International Public Sector Accounting Standards (IPSAS). B. Accounting standards and policies relating to specific transactions in financial statements 20% 1. Tangible non-current assets Calculate, where necessary, discuss and account for tangible non-current assets in accordance with the provisions of relevant accounting standards (IAS 16, IAS 20, IAS 23, IAS 40, IFRS 5, and IFRS 16). 2. Intangible non-current assets (IAS 38) Calculate, where necessary, discuss and account for intangible non-current assets in accordance with the provisions of IAS 38. 3. Impairment of tangible and non-intangible assets (IAS 36) Calculate, where necessary, discuss and account for impairment of tangible and intangible non-current assets (excluding financial assets and liabilities) in accordance with the provisions of IAS 36. 4 Fair value measurement, financial assets and liabilities (a) Differentiate between debt and equity financial instruments. (b) Calculate, where necessary, discuss and account for financial instruments using amortised cost or fair value measurement in accordance with the provisions of relevant accounting standards (IAS 32, IFRS 7, IFRS 9 and IFRS 13) with respect to measurement (including fair value and amortised cost), recognition, de-recognition and disclosures, excluding hedging but including simple impairment cases.
5. Inventories and revenue from contracts (IAS 2, IFRS 15) Calculate, where necessary, discuss and account for inventories and revenue from contracts in accordance with the provisions of relevant accounting standards (IAS 2 and IFRS 15). 6. Provisions, contingent liabilities and assets, and events after the reporting period (IAS 10, IAS 37) Calculate, where necessary, discuss and account for provisions, contingent liabilities and assets as well as events after the reporting period in accordance with the provisions of relevant accounting standards (IAS 10, IAS 37). 7. Income taxes (IAS 12) Calculate, where necessary, discuss and account for income tax including current and deferred tax in accordance with the provisions of IAS 12. 8. Earnings per share (IAS 33) Calculate, discuss and account for earnings per share (EPS) in accordance with provisions of IAS 33. C. Preparation and presentation of general purpose financial statements 20% Preparation of financial statements 1. Discuss accounting policies and changes in accounting policies in accordance with the provisions of IAS 8, where necessary. 2. Prepare and present general purpose financial statements including statement of financial position, statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income, statement of changes in equity and relevant notes in accordance with IAS 1. 3. Prepare and present statement of cash flows for single entities in accordance with IAS 7, using direct and indirect methods. 4. Prepare value added statement and five year financial summary in accordance with Companies and Allied Matters Act 2020. D. Preparing and presenting financial statements of simple group (parent, one subsidiary and an associate) 25% 1. Understanding a simple group (a) Explain the concept of group especially a simple group and the objectives of preparing group financial statements. (b) Discuss the provisions of the relevant accounting standards for the preparation and presentation of financial statements of simple group – (IAS 27, IAS 28, IFRS 3 and IFRS 10), including the use of fair value for non-controlling interest.
(c) Calculate non-controlling interest using alternative methods and effect necessary adjustments required to prepare the financial statements of simple group. 2. Preparation and presentation (a) Prepare and present statement of financial position of a simple group (one subsidiary and an associate in accordance with the provisions of relevant standards (IAS 1, IAS 27, IAS 28, IFRS 3 and IFRS 10). (b) Prepare and present statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income of a simple group (one subsidiary and an associate), in accordance with the provisions of relevant standards (IAS 1, IAS 27, IAS 28, IFRS 3 and IFRS 10). (c) Prepare and present statement of cash flows of a simple group (one subsidiary and an associate), in accordance with the provisions of IAS 7. (d) Discuss management disclosures, analysis and commentaries on financial statements. E. Analyses and interpretation financial statements 20% 1. Analyses of financial statements (a) Identify and discuss types of analyses and interpretation of financial statements. (b) Discuss various aspects of financial position and performance that may be assessed (profitability, liquidity/solvency, gearing, investors’ returns) through the analyses and interpretation of financial statements. (c) Define ratio, identify and calculate various types of ratios used in the assessment of financial position and performance of a business entity. (d) Analyse and interpret computed ratios and assess the current period financial position and performance of a business entity in comparison to: (i) Its prior period; (ii) Another given entity for the same period; and (iii) Industry average for the same period. (e) Analyse and interpret computed ratios and assess the current period financial position and performance of a simple group (one subsidiary and associate) in comparison to: (i) Its prior period; (ii) Another given simple group entity for the same period; and (iii) Industry average for the same period. (f) Discuss the use of statement of cash flows in assessing liquidity and compare its usefulness with that of a statement of profit or loss and other comprehensive income when assessing liquidity and going concern of a business entity.
(g) Explain the use of earnings per share (EPS) in assessing the performance of corporate entities in the capital market, especially capital market reaction to earnings announcement. (h) Where necessary, write reports as may be required when analysing and interpreting the financial position and performance of a business entity and simple group, drawing conclusions, making recommendations and giving advice from the perspectives of different stakeholders. 2. Limitations of analyses and interpretation of financial statements (a) Discuss the limitations of historic financial information in the analyses and interpretation of financial statements. (b) Explain how financial statements may be manipulated and discuss the impact of window dressing and creative accounting on calculated ratios and how they can distort analyses and interpretation of financial statements. (c) Explain how analyses and interpretation of financial statements of specialized and not-for-profit organizations differ from those of profit-oriented organizations. (d) Explain why earnings per share (EPS) trend may be a better indicator of performance when compared with a company’s profit trend and discuss the limitations of using EPS as a performance measure. (e) Explain why and how the use of consolidated financial statements might limit analyses and the use of interpretation techniques. (f) Discuss the use of other information, including non-financial information relevant to the assessment of an entity’s performance. F. Ethics and current developments in financial reporting 5% 1. Discuss and apply ethical issues in financial reporting. 2. Discuss developments around the inclusion of non-financial information in financial reporting. 3. Discuss new accounting standards in issue as may be specified from time to time. 4. Discuss the application of block chains and related technologies
Applicable Accounting Standards

2. Conceptual Framework for Financial Reporting
3. IAS 1 - Presentation of Financial Statements
4. IAS 2 - Inventories
5. IAS 7 - Statement of Cash Flows
6. IAS 8 - Accounting Policies, Changes in Accounting Estimates and Errors
7. IAS 10 - Events after the Reporting Period
8. IAS 12 - Income Taxes
9. IAS 16 - Property, Plant and Equipment
10. IAS 20 - Accounting for Government Grants and Disclosure of Government Assistance
11. IAS 23 - Borrowing Costs
12. IAS 27 - Separate Financial Statements
13. IAS 28 - Investments in Associates
14. IAS 32 - Financial Instruments: Presentation

16. IAS 36 - Impairment of Assets
17. IAS 37 - Provisions, Contingent Liabilities, and Contingent Assets
18. IAS 38 - Intangible Assets
19. IAS 40 - Investment Property
20. IFRS 3 - Business Combinations
21. IFRS 5 - Non-current Assets Held for Sale and Discontinued Operations
22. IFRS 7 - Financial Instruments: Disclosures
23. IFRS 9 - Financial instruments
24. IFRS 10 - Consolidated Financial Statements
25. IFRS 13 - Fair Value measurement
26. IFRS 15 - Revenue from contracts with customers
27. IFRS 16 - Leases
target_audience: This course is for professional accountancy students of Institute of Chartered Accountants of different countries.

courses.title: Analista Fiscal para Iniciantes
courses.bio: Aprende o departamento fiscal do absoluto zero!
objectives: Você será capaz de entender todos os termos técnicos sem precisar de ter um conhecimento na área fiscal;
Aqui vamos te ensinar o conteúdo planejado da melhor forma para você dominar de uma vez por todas esse departamento;

Na prática - registro de nota fiscal

requirements: O curso não tem pré-requisitos, é para qualquer pessoa que deseja aprender o departamentos fiscal do zero.
courses.description:
Tudo aquilo que é fundamental, necessário e imprescindível para desenvolver as atividades dessa função, você vai aprender aqui comigo.


Pensando em pessoas como você, eu desenvolvi o curso ANALISTA FISCAL PARA INICIANTES 2.0 – para te mostrar como é simples aprender sobre o departamento fiscal. Você vai aprender a prática sem ter experiência, e através desse conhecimento, terá novas conquistas na carreira, eu te garanto!


Você será capaz de entender todos os termos técnicos sem precisar de ter um conhecimento na área fiscal.


Conheça o MAF – Manual do Analista Fiscal: um mapa mental que vai te auxiliar na hora de assistir as aulas e ainda te ajudar quando quiser consultar alguma informação. Essa é uma nova forma de aprender, de maneira objetiva e didática.


Criamos um método de ensino que te entregará todo o conteúdo relacionado com fiscal de um jeito organizado e simplificado. Aqui vamos te ensinar o conteúdo planejado da melhor forma para você dominar de uma vez por todas esse departamento.


Você pode fazer o curso de Analista Fiscal no seu ritmo, na velocidade que desejar, pode pausar e rever as aulas quantas vezes quiser. O treinamento pode ser acessado por tablets, computadores e celulares.


BÔNUS
*Conheça o MAF – O Mapa do Analista Fiscal: ele apresenta um novo formato de aprendizado e que vai te proporcionar uma explicação didática, te auxiliando a entender tudo sobre o departamento fiscal;
*Apostila completa do curso, que você pode usar nas aulas e também no seu trabalho;
*Uma planilha completa, com links úteis que vão te auxiliar na hora em que fizer uma pesquisa.
